Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY. Bringing out the best in people As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us. Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to: Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development. Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture. Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation. Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.  Reporting directly to the Site Lead, the Digital Engineer will assist with the site wide implementation of software and automated digital solutions. The associate will work cross functionally to ensure that identified solutions meet stakeholder requirements, both during implementation and as the processes evolve over time. The associate will develop end user training and provide on-going support to internal customers, as well as be the primary point-of-contact with external vendors and integrators. The associate will work within a FDA/ISO regulated facility requiring the development and execution of appropriate validation/qualification protocols for specific initiatives. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Primary responsibility is support of industrial CT Scanning program for customized dental applications. The associate will become the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for end to end CT scanning process. Scanning process includes physical processes of material handling, scanning, and disposition, Scanning process includes automated digital processes, scanned volume file conversion to desired surface files, surface file delivery to endpoint for pick up by API. Scanning process includes interaction with Salesforce CRM for tracking of jobs, including unique ID of each case and maintaining case status through process. Institute process controls to ensure robustness of processes and safe operation. Primary point of contact for technical troubleshooting of the scanning process for both DentsplySirona and Byte stakeholders. Develop and deliver training for end users regarding physical process flow, automated CT- scanning of cases, and final disposition of completed cases. Help with the development and execute validation/qualification protocols to support business/operational initiatives including customer backorder minimization, cost reduction, non-conformance reduction, complaint reduction, yield/process reliability improvement, and FDA/ISO compliance requirements. As assigned, investigate and implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPAs) to meet business and compliance requirements. Support value streams by recommending and implementing automated solutions to drive efficiency at the site. Associate will be innovative, knowledgeable and intensely committed to ensure that every product and service we supply conforms to FDA and Quality System Regulations, as well as ISO 13485 Standards. TYPICAL BACKGROUND BS/BA degree from four-year College or university in an engineering, computer, or other technical field. Experience in a manufacturing environment is preferred. Previous experience with industrial CT preferred. 1 to 3 years of experience with responsibility for implementing and managing an automated workflow. Ability to understand and document all steps and decisions involved in manufacturing processes (such as by process mapping). Experience in working with industrial CT hardware and associated processing software, i.e. Volume Graphics, Geomagic. Ability to create and maintain automated queries. Development Manager  We are EA  And we make games – how cool is that? Work with Madden feature development teams with to lock down requirements and specifications. Proficient with MS Word, MS Project, Excel (can perform complex functions), PowerPoint, confluence, sprint planning, slack, support ticket management (example: Jira or JaaS) Experience working with DevOps team.

Software Engineer at STILMAN US citizen required We are looking to bring on an additional Senior Software Engineer to work on our primary back end applications in C++ that include custom Artificial Intelligence (AI) engine, military modeling and simulation framework (M&S), and integration capabilities for our own front end and for 3rd party systems. This system leverages a range of communication protocols, complex data structures and algorithms, GIS & geometric concepts, and high performance optimizations to support a growing range of use cases. You will be expanding our core AI and M&S frameworks to support new domains (from ground forces to ballistic missiles), use cases (from analysis to real-time wargaming), fidelity of modeling of real world environments and entities, and AI-enabled tactics generation. You will also be integrating our software with other M&S systems, military C2 and Intelligence systems, and supporting varied computing environments (from containers in the cloud to embedded computer in a combat vehicle). You will take part in design of new features or redesigning existing ones based on customer needs and feedback, implementation of the software changes using C++ with constant focus on performance and optimization, model military concepts in software, work closely with front end software developers on APIs, data representation and protocols, as well as work with 3rd party software developers to find user centric ways to integrate our systems. Key Experience to Have Professional, enterprise grade, C++ software development experience of 3-6 years Development for Windows OS Performance Optimization Data Structures and Algorithms Great Bonus Experience to Have (which combo do you bring to the table?) Modeling & Simulation (M&S) GIS & Mapping Geometric algorithms Mercurial, Git, SVN CI/CD, Jenkins Docker & Kubernetes Linux Military concepts and tactics Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, and other languages STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs. The Team We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites and we've been doing this for 20 years. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. This small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products. Benefits & Other - We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance- Colorado only- Starting base pay can range from 100K- 120K. US Citizenship is required. No CTC or 3rd parties please. Thanks for considering STILMAN Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

This Senior Tools Software Engineer role within the mobile QE organization collaborates with QA and Game Development to create tools and technical strategies with the goals of improving game development infrastructure and increasing efficiencies in the Development and QA processes. You will ensure a seamless partner experience, focusing on understanding our partner's needs and building proper tooling solutions to satisfy their requirements and blend in with their existing workflows. You will report to the Quality Engineering technology leader, who will help you identify new technologies and develop new tools for testing and tracking purposes. You will also be an on the ground leader in local team and wider Quality Engineering organization.  Primary Responsibilities  Create technology and guide usage and support: You will collaborate with your Quality Engineering Technical Director, Game Development and QA partners to identify areas for improvement through new tools and automation strategies. You will build and deploy internal software tools to our Game Development and QA partners. You will support an increased adoption of automation and tools within game teams. Aid in the identification and requirements gathering for new tools. You will identify and recommend debug and telemetry enhancements to aid testing. You will provide senior technical expertise and debug support to other engineers on our teams. You will promote code quality and SOLID design principles for the team. You will utilize and promote proper use of architectural and design patterns for building our tools. You will lead in knowledge sharing sessions - increasing knowledge of existing tools, automation and testing processes. You will perform risk analysis of new features – identifying impact and scope. You will help promote bug fixing efforts and identifying areas of test focus.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or equivalent 7+ years of professional experience with a focus on concepts and language varieties 7+ years of professional experience with .NET, C#, C++ (deep C# experience is an essential requirement for this role). Understand the software development life cycle, software engineering methodologies and practices, and their application to both development and QA. Understand software quality assurance concepts, debugging processes. Web-based systems experience an asset. Technical writing experience is an asset. Experience with mobile app development ecosystems (Android and/or iOS) is an asset.

About Stryker Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com It's time to join Stryker! We are a great place to work. Fortune, in association with Great Place to Work, named us among the World’s Best Workplaces. We currently rank #5 out of the 25 companies on the list. This list highlights companies that have gone above and beyond to create a great workplace for employees all over the world. Fortune also named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work for in the United States. This is the tenth consecutive year we have been on the list, and we ranked #8 out of 100! Who We Want Software Enthusiast. People who can come up creative design for complex software program and seek out the tough bugs to fix. Curious learners. Engineers who seek out cutting-edge research and information to expand and enhance their ability to develop software. Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices. What You Will Do In this role, you will lead the design and development of new computer and robot-assisted surgery systems, technologies, and applications to support Stryker's strategic long term product development roadmap. You will perform system design, integration, design review, verification and validation of multidisciplinary systems, technologies and feasibility efforts including robotics system, embedded software, electronics, mechanisms, cutting systems and surgical navigation systems to deliver robotic-assisted orthopedics solutions. You will also will work in close collaboration with Program Management, Quality Assurance, Marketing, Advanced Operations and Global Quality teams for Stryker customers. You will contribute to product development from concept through release. You will participate in creating, analyzing, and proving System Error and Performance Budgets for the robotics system. You will develop control algorithms to support our next generation of robotics system. You will develop kinematic and dynamic modeling of a robotic arm. You will develop prototype and production grade software. You will design and implement complex systems including system architectural design, relevant design documentation, test planning and execution. You will generate innovative technologies and solutions and submit invention disclosures. You will travel as necessary for project design meetings, supplier meetings, and professional meetings. You will collaborate with R&D, Quality, Manufacturing, Regulatory, Clinical, Marketing and Project Management to ensure project success as a leader on the team. You will identify and support the creation of or improvements to procedures, policies, processes, systems, and technology. You will support and execute segments of complex product development to advance projects through the design /development/launch process. You will deliver high quality results with passion, energy and drive to meet business priorities. What You Need Bachelor's degree in a related field required. Master's or PhD highly desired. 4+ years of related industry experience What We Would Love That You Have (Preferred Qualifications) Real-time programming in C or C++ highly preferred Experience with advanced control systems of robotic or haptic devices. Experience in robotic modeling including kinematics and dynamics Modeling and simulation languages e.g. MATLAB/Simulink Familiarity with a variety of sensor, actuator, motor and controller technologies Why Stryker? “It’s the people.” That’s the answer you’ll hear most often when you ask our employees why they love working here. Come join our team at Stryker in Weston, FL! Know someone at Stryker? Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

As the Lead Software Engineer, the primary function of this position is to research, design, develop, and test operating systems-level software for retail and general computing applications. Summary Posted: Feb 5, 2021 Role Number:200220187 Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, we enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices. The Graphics Software Engineer will be responsible for delivering high-quality GPU applications and test suites to meet the needs of GPU development and verification. This includes writing applications to stress and verify the GPU’s architecture, functionality, performance, and power. This individual will collaborate closely with the architecture team, modeling team, and hardware design teams. Key Qualifications Expertise in one or more GPU 3D APIs (OpenGL, DirectX, Metal, etc.) Experience in GPU shading languages (GLSL, HLSL, Metal, etc.) The ideal candidate will have expertise and knowledge of graphics rendering algorithms Excellent C/C++ programming and scripting skills GPU modeling experience is a plus Experience with graphics device drivers a plus GPU hardware and architecture knowledge Experience with hardware design methodologies and tools (Verilog, DPI, design verification, etc.) The ability to work well in a team in order to be productive under aggressive product schedules Description We define, write, and debug GPU applications and test suites targeting the verification of architecture, functionality, performance, and power. Design and implement GPU level verification API and tools We create automated flows for graphics core verification Support GPU hardware and software teams during model and design bring-up We create bit-accurate C/C++ models for hardware verification Education & Experience BS/MS/PhD CE, EE, or CS.

Kin Insurance is on a mission to change home insurance from what it could be to what it should be. We’re proud to offer affordable insurance coverage in areas most impacted by climate change, like Florida, California and Louisiana, that pay more for insurance than anywhere else in America. We are also proud to be recognized as Built In’s 2021 Best Midsize Companies to Work For in Chicago and Forbes 2021 Best Startup Employers in America. We are growing super fast, and we need forward-thinking, inspired game-changers like you to help lead the way. So, what’s the role?  As an Engineering Lead, you will lead small teams, mentor and train less experienced engineers as well as assist with design and architecture decisions. As the Engineering Lead on projects and initiatives, you’ll oversee your engineers while jumping in to solve more advanced problems. After every couple or few initiatives leading teams, you’ll be able to step back into an individual contributor role where you can focus on deep coding work before rotating back to the lead function. You will work closely with our product, design, and QA teams, and utilize both your technical expertise and leadership skills to guide others and identify solutions to difficult problems. A day in the life could include: Owning significant technical aspects of projects Leading small teams for product or feature development initiatives Mentoring and guiding engineers through earlier stages of development Writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code in Ruby on Rails Removing blockers from other team members Communicating technical topics to other team members in clear, effective ways Providing subject matter expertise and support I’ve got the skills… but do I have the necessary ones? 6+ years of professional software engineering experience 3+ years developing Ruby applications Experience mentoring and leading small teams of software engineers Comfortable in a startup environment – we’re fast-paced, self-motivated, and determined to change the industry A fast learner, ready to bring previous knowledge to this position and continue developing along the way Experience helping teams scale quickly Enjoy mentoring and training others At this time, we are unable to sponsor employment visas. Oh, and don’t worry, we’ve got you covered! Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (including 100% employer-paid plans) Remote Work (due to Covid-19) and flexible work hours Flexible PTO policy Very generous equity options and 401K Parental Leave Continuing education and professional development Disability and Life Insurance Onsite gym membership - when we return to the office (Chicago office only) The excitement of joining a high-growth Insurtech company and seeing your work make an impact  About Kin:  In an industry that hasn't budged in more than 100 years, our technology transforms the user experience, cuts inefficiencies that waste billions of consumer dollars, and customizes coverage homeowners want. We believe insurance was always meant to be a digital product – we’re making that a reality. Our approach to the industry makes us unique, and the people at Kin help us excel. We’re a team of problem solvers, collaborators, builders, and dreamers who are passionate about creating positive change in the lives of our customers and in our industry. Kin is more than just our name – it’s how we treat each other. That’s one of the many reasons we’ve been recognized as a great place to work by Built In, Forbes, and Fast Company. EEOC Statement  Kin is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We don't just accept difference – we honor it, nurture it, and celebrate it. We don’t discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

TL;DR : Le job en quelques mots Cleyrop est un DataHub en pleine création. Nous sommes au début de l’aventure, l’équipe est en train de s’assembler et on te propose une place centrale dans l’équipe lab R&D , être en charge de la partie Devops. Explorateur mais surtout Doer , tu sais analyser les besoins clients et internes pour anticiper les prob l ématiques , dérisquer et t ’assurer du succès du produit.  L’aventure que tu pourrais rejoindre Nous avons créé Cleyrop début 2021 avec pour objectif de créer le premier DataHub européen. Pourquoi ? Car aujourd’hui, c’est encore trop complexe. Car aujourd’hui, on se tourne vers des acteurs américains qui ne font qu’une partie du chemin. Car aujourd’hui, le pouvoir de la data doit être à la portée de chacun (e). Now what ? Chez Cleyrop , On est convaincus d’un monde où chacun pourrait prendre le contrôle de ses données afin d’en démultiplier l’usage. C’est pourquoi nous avons créé le premier DataHub européen industriel, sécurisé et modulaire qui embarque les meilleures solutions européennes dans une plateforme consistante et prête à déployer. Les enjeux sont importants, les ambitions aussi (CA 2021 3M€ et CA 2022 10M€). On vient de lever 4 Millions en Seed auprès de business angels et de la BPI ce qui nous permet de nous lancer dans ce défi. On attend plus que toi ! Pourquoi ce recrutement ?  Aujourd’hui , on doit à la fois développer notre portail et préparer son intégration avec nos partenaires . Une équipe de développeurs et développeuses s’ attèle déjà à la pa rtie produit, mais l’écosystème Data est tellement vaste et changeant qu’il nous faut une équipe dédiée à la découverte et aux tests des nouvelles solutions, et no uveaux partenaires . Pour mener à bien cette mission, n o us avons besoin d’un (e) aventurier (e) , une personne capable de comprendre les concept s archite c turaux mais surtout de mettre les mains dans le cambouis , tout en menant à bien la phase d’exploration et de “Proof of concept”. Tu travailleras avec notre équipe tech déjà présente dans l’aventure, équipe très diverse et complète avec Arnaud ( Cofounder ) , Gregory (Archi) , Franck (VP Engineering) , Yann (Lead DevOps) , Luis (Lead Dev) .  Ce qui t'attends si tu nous rejoins  Si tu nous rejoins, tes principaux objectifs seront les suivants :  A court terme : Arriver à craque r les problèmes d’intégration actuels pour préparer la première version du produit  Dans les premiers mois, mettre en place les premières intégrations fonctionnelles  Mettre en place des briques pour permettre à l’équipe tech d’accélérer le développement du produit et l'intégration des produits partenaires.  A long terme : M ettre en place un système pour anticiper les besoins d’ intégrations des développeurs / développeuses pour ne pas bloquer mais plutôt faciliter leur quotidien  Être en c apacit é de déployer en continu à la fois chez nos clients et en interne  Avoir mis en place une plateforme agnostique du cloud sous-jacent  ‍ Une journée type sur ce rôle sera ponct u ée de phases de recherches et d’expérimentation suivi de phases de prototypage , d’itération et de développement . Une part importante de la journée pourra être passée à interagir avec nos différents partenaires en externe et nos différentes équipes en interne. Rédiger de la documentation, des process, et être garant de sa bonne application seront aussi des éléme nts importants pour que nos équipes soient plus efficaces . Enfin, évidemment, une partie de la journée sera passée à coder pour construire avec les équipes le premier Datahub européen !  C'est pour toi si : Si ce défi t’attire , voici ce que l’on attend de toi. Les premières compétences sont requises et cruciales mais si tu ne coche s pas les suivantes, ce n’est pas grave.  Les compétences requises sont les suivantes : Une grande curiosité naturelle et une approche agnostique concernant les technologies , cumulée à une capacité à pouvoir évangéliser et vulgariser ton quotidien  Du pragmatisme en arrivant à se concentrer sur ce qui a le plus d’impact ainsi qu’une capacité à gérer plusieurs sujets de front et plusieurs types d’interlocuteurs et d’interlocu trices.  On attend de toi une forte connaissance de l’environnement DevOps dans lequel tu évoluerais depuis au moins 5 ans pour avoir vu pas mal de chose sans forcément t’être spécialisé(e) dans un domaine en particulier . (On parle de Kubernetes , Docker mais aussi Shell, ssh ...)  Et si en plus tu coche s les cases suivantes, tu seras notre candidat(e) idéal :  Tu es passionné (e) par l’univers de la data et tu as envie de nous aider à créer le premier Datahub européen. Plus qu’une mission d’entreprise, nous pensons que c’est nécessaire !  Evidemment, tu maitrises différents langages, différents environnents et le plus tu auras vu, le mieux ça sera (on ne va pas se mentir).  Tu es déjà engagé(e) dans l’écosystème devops et/ou Data et/ou dataops et tu es animé ( e ) par une mission importante d’ évangélisation  Notre process de recrutement Ces compétences et ces expertises seront vérifiées au cours de notre process de recrutement, défini spécialement pour ce job. Le but est de test er le fit de chaque côté. 1/ D’abord un premier entretien avec Léo , notre Head of Talent , pour parler de tes ambitions professionnelles et identifier si ce que tu veux faire convient avec nos besoins et inversement . L’échange portera également sur la culture d’entreprise. 2/ Le second entretien avec Yann , notre devops leader sera un entretien très porté sur les technos, tes expériences précédentes et ce que tu as déjà mis en place mais ça sera surtout l’occasion pour toi de poser toutes tes questions pratiques. 3/ L a troisième et derni ère étape sera avec Arnaud , cofondateur et Franck , VP Engineering, pour parler de problématiques tech plus high level et voir avoir toi les perspectives d’apprentissage et d’évolution sur le poste. Ça sera aussi l’occasion de pousser encore plus ta compréhension de cleyrop .  A n'importe quelle étape, tu pourras appeler un Joker et Lauren, cofondatrice, prendra 30min avec toi pour répondre à tes questions. On fera la même chose si jamais on a un point en particulier que nous souhaitons évaluer.  Une dernière chose, chez Cleyrop , nous sommes engagé (e)s contre les discriminations, quelles qu’elles soient et nous luttons de manière active pour constituer une entreprise la plus diverse possible . Le premier exemple pour cela étant notre volonté explicite d’avoir un mode de travail “ work from anywhere ” ( et non pas de le subir) , cela nous permet notamment de ne pas discriminer à l’embauche sur le lieu de travail / la capacité à déménager ou non. Mais cela nous permet aussi par exemple de pouvoir recruter des personnes qui, comme nous, ont une volonté de concilier du mieux possibles leurs vies personnelles et professionnelles.  N’hésite plus et viens nous rencontrer, Léo t’attend déjà pour le premier entretien !!!

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Are you excited about building innovative solutions? Job Summary: The Lead Software Engineer is responsible for the architecture and design of a large, custom off the shelf application used for various functions in Workforce Management portfolio. The Lead Software Engineer will collaborate with business stakeholders, technology stakeholders, and the 3rd party delivery vendor to agree upon the appropriate solution and technical design to meet business requirements, performance standards, resiliency and availability standards, and security requirements. This will also include estimating, planning and overseeing development activities being executed. The ideal candidate has a proven track-record of integrating complex vendor-hosted SaaS solution. Responsibilities: The successful candidate requires technical knowledge and skills that are broad and deep, covering various hardware, software, and platforms. The candidate must be comfortable operating in complex heterogeneous technology environments, and have experience with highly integrated and mission critical solutions. The candidate must possess the ability to share and communicate ideas clearly, both orally and in writing, to business sponsors and partners, technical resources, and executives, in clear concise language that is the effective for each respective group. Equitus Corporation is looking for an energetic, positive individual to fill the role of Video Analytics Engineer at our small office located in Clearwater, FL. We seek to expand the current state-of-the-art to infer functional relationships between detected objects and people. · Explore novel AI/ML model development for video analysis in areas including self-supervised learning, anomaly detection, multi-sensor fusion and spatio-temporal algorithms for dynamic object tracking. Techniques for reducing computational resources of video analytics models such as binarization, pruning, and merging multiple pre-trained models – will be investigated to enable deployment of advanced video pipelines on minimal hardware resources. Solutions will be benchmarked in an Enterprise surveillance environment. · Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or Data Science coursework or experience required. Job Summary:  The Disney Parks Experiences and Products (DPEP) Technology team combines custom technology solutions with creativity to produce robust applications that enhance all aspects of the guest experience. From one of the most sophisticated hotel reservation systems in the world to Disney Cruise Line shipboard systems, Disney Vacation Club member services, ticketing, PhotoPass, and even inventory applications to ensure we have the right number of Cast costumes. This Engineer will work with business partners to perform site walks, work on installation recommendations, hardware layout, sustainment planning, and oversee installation. This development will involve familiarity and the ability to switch between multiple languages and projects will the goal of building new software components that can be used by a variety of clients in multiple use cases.  As part of the IoT installation, this Engineer will need to be able to help troubleshoot and navigate network issues at multiple layers with multiple teams managing the network equipment and firewalls. The Engineer should be able to troubleshoot these issues as part of installation and support. They should have be able to understand and advise on basic topics from multiple disciplines of engineering.  Be a part of a transformative team and culture participating on team projects while learning and experiencing new technologies.  DPEP Technology seeks forward-thinking team members who are passionate about delivering a quality product, and enjoy working closely with business partners on both strategic and tactical challenges. Candidate should have good verbal and written communication skills, and be able to work independently as a self-starter, utilize good time management skills, and function well within a diverse team. Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) is looking for a candidate to join our Software Development Team, located at Eglin Air Force Base (AFB), Florida, in the creation and maintenance of Joint Munitions Effectiveness Manual (JMEM) Weaponeering System (JWS) products. JWS is an operational software application that consists of a collection of simulation models and software tools used to determine the probabilistic effectiveness of air-to-surface and surface-to-surface munitions against a wide variety of materiel and structural targets. JWS is used by US Army, Navy, and Air Force operational communities to authenticate weapons effectiveness data for use in operations, training, systems acquisitions, weapons procurement, and combat modeling and simulation (M&S). Modern JWS development is built on the Endgame Framework (EF) architecture to allow scene-based simulation and display of single and multi-targeting engagements. EF is a cutting-edge software architecture that provides advanced development features to include reusable software modeling constructs, 3D geometric model interrogation and visualization, integrated Graphical User Interface (GUI) constructs, executive control across multiple processors, and a comprehensive set of M&S tools/utilities. This position requires a B.S. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering or an equivalent field, in addition to 5-7 years of software development experience. Applicants should possess a deep understanding of advanced software constructs and programming concepts using C++ in an object oriented architecture. Applicants should also have good communication skills and a solid understanding of mathematical/physics concepts applicable to modeling and simulation solutions. Additional consideration will be given to candidates who possess skills/experience with 3D geometric modeling, 3D visualization with OpenGL, or simulation/analysis of weapons effects. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and be comfortable working in a fast-paced, process-driven, team environment of professional Engineers, Software Engineers, Test Engineers, and Analysts to meet the multi-service weaponeering goals set forth by the Joint Technical Coordinating Group for Munitions Effectiveness (JTCG/ME). ARA is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems. This position is located at Eglin AFB, in the city of Valparaiso, Florida on the gulf coast of Florida. ARA offers an excellent benefits package that includes: 401-K Retirement with employer matching contribution Employee Stock Ownership Plan Various insurance options including Flexible Spending Plan and a Health Savings Account (HSA) Paid leave and holidays How to apply: You must be a U.S. Citizen to apply. Selected applicants will be subject to a government security investigation, must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information, and must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. DoD Security Clearance. ARA is an EEO and Affirmative Action employer. Please submit your resume, referencing job number: SOFTW04308 Specific duties and responsibilities include: Design and implementation of software according to requirements using C++, C#, SQLite and Endgame Framework Decompose requirements, track work items, control source code, perform peer reviews and create software documentation using Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket and Fisheye/Crucible Create and maintain software unit tests to verify functionality Coordinate with other in-house developers and engineers to verify successful implementation and determine how well the final product satisfies the defined requirements Required Skills: 5+ years of C#, C++ (or equivalent) development experience with a good understanding of advanced software constructs and programming concepts Understanding of mathematical and physics concepts Good communication skills and ability to work with a distributed team of software developers, engineers, and analysts Familiarity with configuration management tools, such as git (or similar) Additional consideration for: Understanding of 3D geometric modeling/visualization Understanding of weapons effects analysis Software development in a CMMI Level 3 environment Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Database Programmer Company Overview: Since 1997, Synergistix has driven the commercial success of Life Sciences companies by enabling them to build strong customer relationships and highly effective sales teams. In addition, Life Sciences companies turn to Synergistix for our sample accountability services and sample management support. As we continue to grow and diversify, we are proud to offer an extraordinary company culture with a variety of exciting opportunities and career paths for dedicated professionals. If you are passionate about a rewarding career in the growing global Life Sciences industry, we’d love to hear from you. To learn more about Synergistix visit, www.synergistix.com. Why Join Us? We are built from a culture where our focus in on the “we” rather than “I,” where honesty and integrity are as integral to our success as our innovative products. We are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic about technology and are customer service driven, team oriented, have a strong desire to learn and teach others. By joining us, you will enjoy working in a unified and collaborative work environment. Position Overview: The Midlevel Database Programmer uses a strong background in design and administration of Microsoft SQL Server, and extensive experience with writing T-SQL stored procedures, triggers, and DTS packages to perform database administration duties. Responsibilities: Administer, maintain, develop and implement policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the company’s SQL Server database. Work with daily data feeds, cleansing and cleanup and data loads. Create and run queries of stored procedures to handle database operations and tasks. Schedule database jobs. Install and run backups and restores on existing databases. Responsible for documenting new and existing processes. Ensure that database improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency. Requires frequent interface with team members and other programming teams Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned.   Skill & Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field strongly preferred. Proven industry experience will be considered in lieu of the degree requirement. Minimum of 3-4 years of demonstrated work experience in database management and operation strongly preferred or at manager’s discretion. Networking knowledge and experience, SQL 2005/08 and SQL CE. Windows NT; Windows 2000 Servers, VBScript, and XML. Experience in designing and maintaining OLTP databases. Troubleshoot database errors and slow database performance. Must have knowledge with replication and topologies, specifically merge replication. Thorough understanding and ability to resolve issues relating to database performance, capacity and monitoring. Understanding of relational database theory and management systems required. Detailed experience creating database Stored Procedures and Triggers. Exceptional customer service and problem solving skills required. Excellent quantitative and analytical skills. Capacity to quickly learn, understand, and apply complex data structures to your work. Ability to resolve issues in a timely, accurate and thorough manner. Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Ability to meet deadlines. Creative thinker with the ability to “think outside of the box”.  Perks of Being a "Synergistian": Synergistix offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Comprehensive health plans with generous company match for employee and dependents. 401k plan Dental and Vision plans Supplemental/Gap Plans Short and Long Term Disability insurance 100% company paid life insurance plan (with buy up) Spouse and Children life insurance plans Up to 5 weeks of Paid Time Off (PTO) Paid Day Off during the month of your birthday Paid Day Off during the month of your service anniversary Company-paid Volunteer Time Flexible work schedules Telecommuting (for qualifying positions) Casual Dress 5 days a week   Synergistix Cares about its Employees: At Synergistix, we care about our employees and their career development, while ensuring a challenging work environment. At Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems (RMS), we understand that sometimes we must pause our professional life to support our family and loved ones. After stepping away from the workplace to care for children, aging parents or other family obligations, the road to return to work can be challenging, and at times intimidating. This is where Chapter Next can be part of your solution! Chapter Next is a 12-16 week paid returnship hosted by RMS. Candidates who have taken a professional career hiatus for at least 2+ years will be eligible to apply to this program. During this returnship participants will become part of a community of similarly experienced professionals with challenging work scopes that contribute to the great innovation produced by Lockheed Martin. Selected candidates will be exposed to comprehensive training, professional development opportunities, networking opportunities, and individual based mentoring Our goal is to provide the fundamental tools needed to be successful in your career field, and to potentially prepare you for an opportunity to join Lockheed Martin full-time. Fields of focus will be diverse across the program and include functional and technical opportunities. The Training and Logistics DevOps Engineering Team is working on many exciting programs and developing groundbreaking products and applications to meet the complex and evolving needs of our customers. We are looking for hardworking software and systems engineers to join our team, working with other engineering disciplines to develop many outstanding products and solutions. This returnship position is for a DevOps – System Engineer and will be located in Orlando, Florida. As a DevOps – System Engineer the individual will support a diverse group of employees to deliver one of the most advanced training systems supporting both domestic and international customers. Reporting to the DevOps Engineering Manager the selected individual will contribute to the Training & Logistics Market in the following ways: Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems Insert role detail and responsibilities Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. Basic Qualifications: Minimum Basic Skills or experience for this position: STEM Bachelor’s Degree (Preferably: Computer Science or Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering) with minimum 5 years of prior professional experience; or 3 year of professional experience with a related Masters degree. Ability to obtain and maintain a Security Clearance Desire to work in a software intensive line of business Adaptability in supporting changing program needs Productively balance autonomy and task commitments Continuous learning mindset Successful communication of ideas and task status Engage in constructive conflict, manage interpersonal dynamics Successful working in a remote environment Experience with System Requirement Development and/or Decomposition Strong Business Acumen including effective oral, written and presentation skills Strong analytical skills and report development, metric and trend analysis Demonstrated leadership abilities Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel) experience Organized and detail oriented, able to handle multiple tasks concurrently Desired Skills: Desired (but not required) Skills: Understanding of Software Intensive System Design Agile Development for DoD Contract experience DOORS application proficiency Atlassian Tool Suite proficiency Ability to read (not necessarily write) software code BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications  Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Hourly/Non-Exempt

Job Description Our business develops software solutions for the aging services industry. This includes meals on wheels organizations, homecare providers, senior centers, adult day providers and more. Our customers are primarily in the United States, but we do have some customers in Canada as well. We are most known in the Meals on Wheels industry as having a best-in-class product. We are in a prime position for growth and we are developing our next generation products to ensure our market position continues to increase. We are looking for a senior engineer that will help support existing technologies and play a significant part of designing and building our next generation solution. Our preference is to have someone working locally from our Cocoa, Florida office. Just 10 minutes from the beach! What you'll do Implementation, coding, testing, deployment, ongoing expansion and maintenance of the framework. Build features in our current stack (C#, ASP.NET MVC Core 2, Web API, OData, and SQL Server). Assessing standards and technologies through experimentation/prototyping Creating and maintaining relevant application design/implementation documentation, providing technical support and guidance to the solution developers Measure, optimize, and scale our current infrastructure. Work with engineers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our product and technical vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter. Articulate a long-term vision for maintaining and scaling our backend systems. A key focus for this role will be to design and develop areas for automation and tools to help with efficiency. Skills & Requirements What we're looking for... Technical leadership for solving complex C# programming tasks and troubleshooting technical issues in Azure cloud. You are at home on a Microsoft stack. Architect, design service-delivery solutions using .NET Core and C# in Azure cloud service environment. You have experience working with Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform. You know how to design and optimize a relational database schema for performance. You are comfortable with distributed version control systems such as Git and Azure DevOps. We currently utilize Azure DevOps. You have experience designing and building APIs (RESTful or otherwise). You have a good grasp of concurrent programming. You’re motivated, self-directed, and are a good communicator. Locally based employment, so please do not apply if you are not currently based within the US. What to expect when you apply... An advanced test will be required prior to an interview. We do not expect a 100% grade on the test. This establishes a base line of your current knowledge in a few key areas that will be used for additional discussions. Phone interviews with another senior engineer, project manager and the president of the company. Onsite interviews with management team. Frameworks we use...You should be comfortable with many if not most of the following and be excited to learn the rest. .NET MVC Core 2 Web API Entity Framework LINQ Moq MsTest / XUnit / NUnit Reactive Extensions Simple Injector / Unity Task Parallel Library (and async / await) WCF Bonus Points If... You know how to write high quality unit tests. You are passionate about programming and contribute to open source projects. You are familiar with the MVVM and dependency injection design patterns. You have some knowledge of client-side web development (ASP.NET MVC and JavaScript). If you have worked on Telerik UI components You have worked with Microsoft Dynamics (or comparable) CRM About Accessible Solutions What we offer... A low ego environment where you can give and receive direct feedback. Transparent leadership that openly shares the thinking behind company direction and strategy. A flat organization where you are encouraged to contribute to company direction and strategy. The opportunity to help shape the future of our industry. A flexible work environment: our preference is office-based work, but we understand that sometimes that doesn’t always work. Medical benefits Job Type: Full-time Job Type: Full-time Pay: $45.00 - $52.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) matching Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Overtime Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Software development: 5 years (Required) Work Location: One location This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail This Company Describes Its Culture as: People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

SUMMARY: We are looking for a motivated Test Engineer to join our dynamic team in Tampa, Florida. This role will work closely with the software development team, develop automation, execute test cases, record results and provide feedback to software development engineers for a variety of software platforms; from in-house production tools, customer applications, embedded platforms and back-end web services and micro-services. If you enjoy a fast-paced environment and would like to be part of great solution which protects and improves the lives of elderly generations, then you may have found your new home. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: · Develop and manage test automation software and scripts. · Develop and manage test automation framework to combine, execute and report results of automated tests developed on different tools and programs. · Develop and manage test automation reporting to test management database. · Promote quality by utilizing critical thinking during the development and testing process: requirements & assumptions, test cases, document design, tasking/ticketing, feature testing, integration testing, system testing, debug, and review at appropriate stages. · Create and manage test plans and test cases from requirements, specifications and designs to ensure product quality. · Responsible for the review, setup and execution of test plans and test cases, both manual and automated. · Tracking, documentation and reporting of test results and defects. · Install, configure, and test software on Windows and Linux platforms, with various application/web servers and databases. · Isolate and report defects to software engineers both written and verbally. · Setup and operate hardware, test and support equipment to facilitate execution of test cases. · Work within the Software Development framework, which promotes development iterations, open collaboration, and adaptability throughout the life cycle of the project. · Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness. · Perform other related duties as assigned by management. · Working with and testing BLE, RFID & sub-gig devices. QUALIFICATIONS: · Experience developing test automation frameworks that execute automated tests developed from different tools, scripts and programs. · Good knowledge of automated testing for web front and back-ends, browsers, web application performance and web services. · Experience developing test automation software in languages such as Java, C#, .Net, SQL, MongoDB. · Experience with Java and .NET development tools and processes (i.e. Visual Studio, Eclipse, IntelliJ, Maven, Gradle). · Experience with automating tests with tools such as Cucumber, TestNG, Junit, Selenium WebDriver, Java w/ Selenium Libraries or equivalent. · Experience with Web Services testing of REST, SOAP, JSON and SSL-related systems using tools like Postman, SoapUI, JMeter, Rest-Assured or equivalent. · Experience with test management systems (XRay, Zephyr, TestRails or equivalent). · Experience with IIS hosted applications and Windows services. · Experience with defect tracking systems (Jira, Bugzilla or equivalent). · Experience developing with Python or other scripting languages. · Experience with source control systems (Git, Perforce or equivalent). · Experience with Load, Stress, and Performance testing, desirable. · Experience automatically updating test database using API, desirable. · Experience with continuous integration tools, desirable (Jenkins, Azure, Octopus or equivalent). · Experience developing software and scripting on Windows and Linux, desirable. · Knowledge of black/white/gray testing, desirable. · Knowledge of embedded systems and hardware, desirable. · Knowledge of MQTT protocol software such as RabbitMQ, AWS SQS, or Mosquito, desirable. · Writing and verbal skills with the ability to present data utilizing programs such as Word, Excel (charts), and PowerPoint or integrated test management tools, desirable. · Basic knowledge of setting up test environments for iOS & Android devices, desirable. EDUCATION: · Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent with 2+ years of experience desired. Staff Software Engineer (Spine Project) Introduction Do you want to be part of a transformative educational technology company? Weld North Education seeks a Staff Software Engineer to design, develop, and maintain software components, systems, and features of the online learning curriculum and assessment. About Us Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn. Mastery with .NET / C# and proficient in other languages and frameworks such as React.js. Proficient in data management and different database technologies, including SQL, NoSQL, GraphDB, etc. Strong understanding and experience with Amazon Web Services or other cloud providers Expert with cloud infrastructure, deployment tools, and operations. Mastery of estimation, engaging with business stakeholders to prioritize timely delivery of epics and initiatives. Motivates team to achieve domain and epic goals through constant improvement Drive for continuous improvement across architecture, engineering and quality Experience with Agile methodologies and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Compensation and Benefits We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university. Equal Opportunity Employer WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We are a Mobile Home dealership w/ a custom-built web application that is the "Operating System" of our business. This web application is 100% PHP and HTML. The system uses the CodeIgniter PHP framework (we are currently transitioning to Laravel). The main features are a CRM with more than 11,000 leads, PDF quote builder with over 14,000 quotes to date, and a call management system for our small call center built on Twilio. The TWO things we are looking for, #1 Be proficient in PHP, HTML, and Javascript #2 Be self-sufficient. Features are often developed on-the-fly with comparatively little direction, flexibility & self direction helps. As long as you are good at what you do, able to implement features with your best judgement, and can finish work in a timely fashion, this will be a good position for you! Essential Skills: PHP, HTML, Javascript, SQL GIT and GitHub / Bitbucket API integration when needed Familiarity with Stripe, Twilio, SendGrid APIs is helpful SEO knowledge highly desirable but not necessary Understanding of MVC and good coding practices What you will do: Maintain existing "Backend" web application (bug fixes, tweaks) Develop new features Supervision will be given by the CEO, technical assistance will be provided where needed by CTO. You will work alongside sales staff and non-technical employees in collaboratively developing features to assist them in their job. Learning their needs and providing solutions with code. You will need to be a good / frequent communicator, especially important if remote. You must be able to take direction if a feature is asked to be developed with a specific technology or in a specific way. Time management is key, we are impressed with candidates that say what they do and are punctual in delivering their results. Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field preferred, unless equivalent experience can be proven. We want to see a portfolio of your work! Kin Insurance is on a mission to change home insurance from what it could be to what it should be. We’re proud to offer affordable insurance coverage in areas most impacted by climate change, like Florida, California and Louisiana, that pay more for insurance than anywhere else in America. We are also proud to be recognized as Built In’s 2021 Best Midsize Companies to Work For in Chicago and Forbes 2021 Best Startup Employers in America. We are growing super fast, and we need forward-thinking, inspired game-changers like you to help lead the way. So, what’s the role?  As a Software Engineer, you'll work on small teams to develop the products and features that make Kin operate. We're a Ruby on Rails environment with JavaScript front-end and PostgreSQL database, and we apply Agile methodologies to our product and software development processes. In your role, you will have the opportunity to work on features and products in a collaborative engineering environment where you can work closely with peers as well as cross-functionally. A day in the life could include: Writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code in Ruby on Rails Delivering stories, tasks, or entire features Pair programming with team members Participating in daily stands and weekly retros Collaborating with cross-functional team members Providing subject matter expertise and support I’ve got the skills… but do I have the necessary ones? 2+ years of professional software engineering experience Proficiency coding in Ruby Comfortable in a startup environment – we’re fast-paced, self-motivated, and determined to change the industry A fast learner, ready to bring previous knowledge to this position and continue developing along the way At this time, we are unable to sponsor employment visas.  Oh, and don’t worry, we’ve got you covered! Description Are you a technology buff with a strong understanding of data who can think outside the box? Does the thought of taking a company into the Industry 4.0 revolution get you excited? Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Knowledge of and experience in ASP.NET Core, ReactJS, VueJS frameworks; JavaScript, Typescript, C# languages; Azure and Google clouds; other modern technologies used to develop scalable performant web, desktop and mobile applications. Ability to mentor other engineers and contribute to their growth. Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing, including presentation skills. Ability to form relationship management, strategy development, project management, problem solving and change management skills. Minimum of two (2) years of experience working with any of the following technologies required: ASP.NET Core, Node.js, ReactJS, Vue.js, React Native frameworks; JavaScript, TypeScript, C# languages.

Description: Movora is a global leader in the veterinary orthopedic market, formed in 2020. Movora formed through the combination of three companies, Kyon (Zurich, Switzerland), BioMedtrix (New Jersey, USA), and VOI (Florida, USA). This role represents an exciting opportunity to work in a high-growth company with global ambitions. This position is working for Veterinary Orthopedic Implants (VOI) in Saint Augustine, FL. The primary responsibility of the Front-End Developer is leading UX experience web projects within our network of companies, and assisting the web developer on large projects. This role is responsible for both front-end development and design maintaining the brand guidelines of each company under the direction of the Marketing team. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Lead UX experience web projects within our network of companies. Design, build and maintain highly reusable JavaScript, HTML, and CSS code. Maintain brand guidelines of each company including the implementation and manipulation of WordPress themes and plugins. Create and maintain digital assets, such as interface design files, wireframes, and interactive mockups. Ensure the creation and implementation of customized experiences for the digital user. Optimize applications for maximum speed. Design mobile-based features. Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability. Maintain a competitive edge against competitor products and industry trends. Product high-quality solutions through flow diagrams, graphic designs, storyboards, and site maps. Proved production-level updates to current eCommerce and static websites. Manage, maintain, and update separate eCommerce websites for Movora’s sub-brands BioMedtrix, KYON, and Veterinary Orthopedic Implants. . Requirements:  BSc in Computer Science or relevant field. 3+ years of proven experience as a front-end developer. Thorough knowledge of front-end web development technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript required. Minimum of 2 years of WordPress development experience required.; Familiarity with custom WordPress themes (Flatsome) & Plugins. Experience working with debugging tools such as Chrome Inspector and Firebug. Understanding of SEO tools such as Google Analytics, Google AdWords, and Bing Ads Management preferred. Advanced Adobe CC skills – Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign.

The Lead Software Engineer applies practical knowledge of development and engineering to conceive, design, develop, test, and implement software fixes, enhancements, components, and/or new software systems and applications of moderate to high complexity. The Lead Software Engineer owns design and development, and drives development of components through his/her own’ and subordinate engineers’ work. The Lead Software Engineer provides technical guidance and acts as a point of escalation and technical expert. The resource will assist with architecture, design and development of highly scalable software systems and applications. Responsibilities: Owns the design and development of software fixes, enhancements, components, and/or new software systems and applications Drives development of components through own and subordinate engineers' work Develops technical solutions that meet specifications and that impact future developments Executes assigned component level software development projects and major fixes using new or existing technologies Develops specifications for assigned components, projects or fixes Reviews or writes code Leads programming, testing and debugging of applications or fixes to existing applications Creates protocols, documentation and tools for installation and maintenance Participates in setting the architectural direction for software development projects Designs specific components for assigned projects, developing specifications for each Designs, develops, manages, creates and maintains technical components and templates Able to code with front-end technology stack and lead end-to-end troubleshooting Interacts and coordinates deliverables with other technical groups in the organization Executes assigned component level projects using new or existing technologies Designs and develops specifications for assigned projects Reviews or troubleshoots and performs testing Participates in conceiving and setting the architectural direction for development projects. Designs the component tasks of assigned projects, developing specifications for each Serves as a high-level technical resource and “go-to” person for less experienced developers, providing technical guidance and oversight Leads team members in problem analysis and issue resolution Recommends improvements to processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of the team  Basic Qualifications: 5 to 8 years of web development, including experience with HTML, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript and libraries like JQuery and Angular Experience with server-side scripting like PHP / Node JS or a similar object-oriented server-side scripting language Experience with Single Page Applications built using javascript frameworks like Angular Experience in mobile app development including Android and iOS is a plus Experience with Java and Microservices Experience writing technical specifications and driving them through development Ability to develop and implement high-quality code in a timely manner is essential Effective verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative and fast paced environment Strong interpersonal skills as well as strong problem-solving and analytical skills Attention to detail  Preferred Qualifications: Deep knowledge of standards-based HTML, CSS and JavaScript Knowledge of mobile app development is a plus Knowledge of server-side scripting language and framework; Node JS / PHP Expertise with JavaScript frameworks like Angular Expertise with Cloud technologies Consumed REST based web services with JSON data Proven ability to work with all members of a technical project team Win-win approach and the ability to work well as part of a broader team Ability to effectively communicate across a broad range of stakeholders, including customers, QA, operations, engineering, management, etc Strong appreciation of the Disney brand and the importance of story Content Management System Architecture knowledge a plus Agile/SCRUM experience a plus Structured programming experience beyond the web Avid interest in new Technology Knowledge of AI/ML algorithms

Overview: Vectorworks Inc. is a global software product company targeting entertainment, architecture and landscape industries with enterprising and intuitive solutions that allow users to create unique designs. We are looking for a remote Python Engineer to build reliable, scalable applications to support our internal business systems and our customer and partner-facing portals. What’s in it for you?  Join a highly collaborative team that provides engineers the freedom to drive change, work on a variety of projects and introduce new ideas. You will work with and get exposed to a range of technologies while building brand new features, creating enhancements and solving challenging engineering problems. Responsibilities: In this role, you should expect to:  Contribute to multiple aspects of our internal applications, which can range from front to back end development, building our APIs, database design, and the occasional tech support. Investigate and identify bugs to determine appropriate fixes. Implement business logic. Provide technical assistance to others. Test development code. Work on multiple projects concurrently and have the flexibility to tackle new needs quickly. Why do you want this job? Because you:  Love solving hard engineering problems and enjoy collaborating with motivated people. Have a desire to work on a thoughtful, nimble team providing business-critical solutions. Are looking to grow your hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies ranging from front-end user interface to back-end systems as well as all points in between. Qualifications: Why do we want you? Because you have:  Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science. Proficiency with Python (3+ years professional experience). Strong Linux experience. Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills – a passion for root cause analysis and problem resolution.  Extra Credit: AWS Django REST APIs Database query languages JavaScript Full stack web development  Vectorworks Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential. with various design and architectural patterns Knowledge of concurrency patterns in C# Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server Experience with popular web application frameworks, such as JavaScript and CSS Familiarity with Windows Presentation Framework Knack for writing clean, readable C# code Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests Proficient understanding of code versioning tools TFS / Devops Server Familiarity with continuous Kentucky Ave

At Modernizing Medicine, we look for passionate, innovative, creative Rock Stars! South Florida Business Journal, Best Places to Work 2021 Inc. Magazine Best Workplaces of 2020 Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America - 2015 - 2019 Marketing Campaign of the Year for Telehealth - Business Intelligence Group's Public Relations & Marketing Excellence Award 2020 Best Use of Technology in Customer Service (Gold) - Customer Sales and Service World Awards® - 2019 Customer Service Department of the Year (Gold) - Customer Sales and Service World Awards - 2018 Modernizing Medicine is delivering truly disruptive and transformative products and services that will impact the healthcare industry. The work we do makes a difference. Our web and mobile applications are transforming healthcare information technology to increase practice efficiency and improve patient outcomes. We offer end-to-end specialty-specific solutions from practice management, through EMR to Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) that maximize office interactions, patient visits, collections and reimbursements. Modernizing Medicine is looking for an accomplished Quality Assurance Test Engineer who will develop and execute automated and manual tests to ensure product quality. The QA Engineer's responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. The QA Engineer plays an important part in our SDLC. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs correctly and meets requirements. Preference will be given to candidates with Strong Automation and Health care experience. You may be a great fit for Mod Med's QA Test Engineer opportunity, IF… You have experience in a fast-paced, startup-like environment. You have loads of passion for highly-usable, modern web experiences and mobile applications. Your Role: Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities. Understand business requirements and develop functional test plans/test cases for new and existing web applications. Test products throughout the software development lifecycle and ensure that all product releases function correctly. Work with product owners and developers to understand requirements and resolve issues. Work with QA Leads to own both Manual & QA automation processes, develop and implement testing techniques, plan the approach to sufficiently test the functionality of new and existing applications. Works with a cross functional team to establish/maintain consistent test methodology. Design, develop and enhance/maintain the QA automation framework and tests using Selenium WebDriver. Strong ability to debug code, analyze failures, and trace defects to the root cause. Maintain, support and extend existing automation for different applications. Make sure all suites are up and running (sanity, smoke, regression & E2E) on Jenkins. Execute Automation scripts prior to production deploy while ensuring that products render and function properly on all major web browsers and mobile devices. Review regression test cases and create a library of test scripts. Provide context driven and structured integration and regression testing. Perform functional, regression, integration, smoke, and user acceptance testing as necessary. Design and build automated test suites. Utilize innovative testing technologies to develop product's automation testing strategy. Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products. Integrate test automation industry standards and best practices. Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies. Make sure the team is on track and will be delivering all assigned tasks on time. Communicate all concerns and status with the team lead in a timely manner. Skills & Requirements: 3+ years' experience in automation testing of consumer facing applications on web/mobile. 5+ years' experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of quality assurance standards for testing. Experience in Agile methodology (preferably scrum) and experience in effective story planning for Product Increment. Automation experience (Selenium, Appium, Soap UI, RestAssured, Postman, Jira). Development/execution of test plans and test scripts. Good understanding of Java. Experience working on complex, large-scale projects. Ability to work under pressure in a multi-task environment. Thirst of learning new technologies and their possible implementation. Bachelor's degree preferred, however, will consider experience or demonstrated knowledge in lieu of a degree. Bonus Points: Great verbal and written communication. Must be able to clearly describe and discuss problems in a timely fashion. Candidates should be self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, and a responsible team-player. Modernizing Medicine Benefit Highlights: Health Insurance, 401(k), Vacation, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts Employee Resource Groups Professional development opportunities including tuition reimbursement programs and unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning Weekly catered breakfast and lunch, treadmill workstations, quarterly onsite massages, onsite dry cleaning, onsite car wash and many more! #LI-LP1 #LI-REMOTE

Bamboo pays for you to take the class, and you walk away with financial savvy and a bonus. Give back. Get paid to give your time to the community: ask us about this!  ***Want to speed up the process? Try our Backend Engineer coding challenge!
