CollaborateMD is looking for a skilled, passionate individual to join our test assurance team. You will work alongside other members of the engineering team to manually test our application prior to production release as well as to create reusable automated tests. The goal of our team is to identify any issues and bugs that were not caught during development in order to ensure the highest quality product is released to our customers. Joining our team will provide opportunities to learn and grow as an engineering professional and as a leader at CollaborateMD. Us: CollaborateMD, an EverCommerce company, is a leader in Practice Management and Medical Billing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) with over 1 million patient claims submitted by doctors and billers using our platform each month. Our software helps healthcare entities thrive in an increasingly complex world by offering best-in-class, affordable products that allow them to focus on what matters most - caring for patients. Where: CollaborateMD headquarters is located in the heart of Downtown Orlando. Our open floor plan, natural light office space delivers panoramic views of Lake Eola & the Central Business District and is home to high-energy, driven people who like to work hard and play hard. Please note that our teams are currently working remotely, so this role will require a reliable internet connection and the ability to set up an in-home office. In-office work is preferred as the office reopens. Core Responsibilities : Partner with members of the software development team to understand the scope and impact of upcoming application changes. Create manual test plans for application changes (small and large). Create reusable, automated test plans for our applications. Participate in peer reviews of test plans created by other team members to provide feedback and help ensure that efficient, complete regression testing is performed before all product releases. Execute manual test plans in support of new application releases and weekly production updates. Conduct root cause analysis for any issues found within production environment (i.e. how to prevent similar escapes in the future). Drive continuous improvement within the department by developing/maturing key processes, documentation, and tools. Must Haves : Expert problem solving skills. Ability to identify combinations and permutations of user actions/input in order to thoroughly test a software application. Ability to pay attention to minute detail and quality. Ability to quickly learn new technologies Effective time management, communication and organizational skills. Splunk's Cloud group is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help lead, design, and build the automation services and infrastructure to deploy critical upgrades at scale across Splunk’s Cloud offering. Collaboration with release management and automated configuration will be a primary focus with keen attention on quality, testing, and validation of surrounding orchestration dependencies. We have a substantial AWS and Kubernetes presence of large-scale containerized systems. This is an incredible opportunity to grow your cloud experience using Golang and Kubernetes to help drive the growth of Splunk Cloud. What You Provide Software Development. We code primarily in Golang, which is the expected language to use day-to-day on the job. Data structures and algorithms. A solid grasp of data structures, algorithms, and RESTful APIs. Kubernetes experience. An understanding of working in Kubernetes systems with experience in kubectl, the operator/controller pattern, and Docker containers. Drive for automation. You constantly consider, "How can I automate this manual process?" Operational excellence. Data excites you and you make decisions based on numbers rather than assumptions. If an issue arises, you strive to be alerted before our customers notice. Unix/Linux. You’ll be using a command line terminal frequently in day-to-day work. Desire to learn and adapt. Our agile team has a lot of projects going on at once, and you'll have the opportunity to learn to navigate the code and features. You'll constantly be learning new areas and new technologies. Passion. Our customers are passionate about Splunk, and we want the same from our engineers. We want you to actively own your work and be excited about your projects. Knowledge of technical excellence. You know continuous delivery, testing, security practices, performance, and disaster recovery. Cloud and container experience. Building and scaling secure services on different cloud providers is a plus. You will use Kubernetes, Docker, and AWS. Keeping calm and carrying on. Capable in navigating through a product outage, skilled in identifying performance bottlenecks, spotting anomalous system behavior, and figuring out the root cause of incidents. What we provide Opportunities to develop and grow as an engineer. We are always expanding into new areas, working with open-source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies. A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support. Breadth and depth. You are interested to work on an area that dynamically scales to meet the need of Splunk’s cloud offering. You want to go deep into optimizing how we automate every manual process and tedious task we encounter. Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe that mentors help both sides of the equation. A stable, collaborative, and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, work together to get things done, and adapt to the changing needs for the team. We keep it real by being open and honest. We are a collaborative team that understands the value in open communication—it's how we interact with our customers. Balance. We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to be successful outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment, and believe that balance helps cultivate a positive environment. Fun. We have frequent group outings and team building events. We are committed to having every employee want to give it their all, be respectful and a part of the family, and have a smile on their face while doing it. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The flight software will be responsible for computing navigation solutions needed for attitude control, managing telemetry and data to and from ground stations or other satellites, and managing command/response management. The payload software will be responsible for managing IR sensors, ingesting IR imagery, and compressing them prior to transmission to ground stations or satellites.  Candidates filling this position will need a clearance at the level specified in “Clearance Level” or will need the ability to get a clearance if not specified. Basic Qualifications: Agile development Architecture design C++ 11 or greater Communication protocols Embedded real-time software development Desired Skills: It is desired that the candidate has experience with or knowledge of one or more skills below: Coordination with customers, partners, vendors Embedded Global Positioning System (GPS) / Inertial Navigation System (INS) – EGI Git – source code versioning / configuration management Inertial Measurement Until (IMU) Infrared (IR) sensors Jira - issue tracking and agile project management MIL-STD 1553 – serial data bus Presentations – oral & written Python - Scripting Technical documentation Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) User Datagram Protocol (UDP) Visio (Microsoft) BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications  Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

What better place to live, work and play than beautiful Fort Myers, Florida? The average year-round temperature is 82°. Hodges University is located in the heart of it all in southwest Florida. Job Description: The Hodges University marketing team is looking for a Webmaster who is responsible for the planning, development, implementation and measurement of the School's website platforms in alignment with the university-wide marketing and branding strategy. The successful candidate has the knowledge, creativity and technical skills in specialized web programming languages, tools, and technology; the exercise of judgment to troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve problems; and the ability to work independently. The successful candidate stays informed of, evaluates and recommends new and emerging web technologies. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining, updating/uploading institutional web page documents on a regular basis according to University specifications, and reviews institutional pages for errors or necessary changes. Build functional website pages that are visually attractive, drive calls to action and are easy to use Regularly updates the look, feel and functionality of the website Tracks and analyzes usage of website, web portal and works collaboratively with University departments to improve website Search Engine Optimization (SEO) strategies Collaborate with marketing staff and vendors on website ad campaigns Create a website style guide for cohesive design elements across all pages Ensures website ADA compliance Continually test website using different devices, browsers, and operating systems Update content on the website to keep pages fresh and intriguing Review the site content and update with current SEO trends Monitor, analyze, and report on all online traffic Analyze site performance Ensure web site and web server functionality and efficiency Make sure related hardware and software are functioning Respond to user complaints quickly and appropriately Manage access rights for users Maintain and update firewalls Optimize site loading speeds Fix broken links and images Meet with the AVP of Marketing to report regularly on current functionality and plans for future functionality Minimize website downtime Communicate ways to improve website functionality and usability Respond to user comments and questions Perform research and set benchmarks on current trends and audience preferences Create graphic content and set specific objectives tied to ROI and generate monthly reports   Requirements: The successful Webmaster candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Design, or a related field, with previous experience as a Webmaster or Web Developer. Required Technical Skills include experience with WordPress content management, fundamental JavaScript, HTML5/XHTML and CSS, Google Analytics, and Adobe Creative. The candidate must have excellent interpersonal skills and strong communication abilities. The position is based on the Fort Myers campus, with travel and evening and weekend hours as needed.   Application Instructions: If you'd like to join our dedicated team of professionals focused on thinking critically and creatively to deliver educational programming and support designed to efficiently develop the workforce in Southwest Florida, click https://hodges.edu/employment-opportunities/

AutoNation Headquarters Position Summary:  AutoNation is looking for a seasoned Hyperion Engineer to assist with development and support of AutoNation’s suite of Hyperion applications; which include Financial Consolidation & Close Cloud Services (FCCS), Enterprise Planning & Budgeting Cloud Services (EPBCS) and Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC). Job Responsibilities: Take part in the support of the FCCS, EPBCS and OAC applications in our new cloud environment Analyze problems as assigned and provide solutions via technical specifications to address business needs Take ownership of data interfaces, automation jobs and other Hyperion processes Produce consistent and accurate technical and end-user documentation of assigned applications Understand how assigned applications/systems link with other programs/processes along with the overall system architecture and provide recommendations on how to improve existing/proposed processes Adhere to company change management practices Provide end user support on Hyperion Essbase and SmartView Supports the monthly application maintenance process Participates in the feasibility analysis for new systems/applications May serve as a technical lead on projects, leading design efforts Monitors the operating efficiency of existing application systems and provides (or arranges for) proactive maintenance Reviews, analyzes, and modifies applications, including coding, testing, configuring, and debugging for new Hyperion applications. Maintains records to document the system and revisions Provides guidance and/or arranges resources for technical support to address production issues Participates in training, as appropriate, on new or revised systems/ applications Tests own work and contributes to the development of test plans and participates in post-implementation reviews Provides second or third level operational support for production systems when necessary. Writes documentation that describes installation and operating procedures Provides guidance to junior team members Communicates applications changes to Technology team members Estimates resource requirements and scope for incoming tasks as needed Technical Expertise: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, similar discipline or extensive Hyperion application admin experience Minimum 5 – 7 years of experience with Hyperion applications Demonstrates an advanced understanding of the following Oracle EPM products: Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) development Data Relationship Management (DRM) Financial Management (HFM)/Financial Consolidation and Close Cloud Services (FCCS) Hyperion Planning/Enterprise Planning and Budgeting Cloud Services (EPBCS) Essbase/Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) Oracle Cloud Rest API Oracle Data Visualization Demonstrates an understanding of the following: SmartView VBA Visual Studio VSTO - Excel C# SQL PowerShell CLI MaxL Acts as a resource to others on the existing applications supporting a business area. Serves as a key resource to ensure the system is performing up to requirements Works independently and provides guidance within technical area, applying in-depth knowledge of multiple technologies, as appropriate Understands architectural issues, and factors them into decisions and recommendations Provides leadership in their area(s) of technical specialization AutoNation is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.  Hyperion, developer, HFM, FCCS, OAC, EPBCS, Cloud, ODI, Fort Lauderdale, South Florida   Company Overview  As America’s largest and most recognized automotive retailer, AutoNation is transforming the automotive industry through its bold leadership, innovation, and comprehensive brand extensions. We are committed to hiring driven, diverse Associates and supporting them in growing their career within AutoNation. We offer paid training, competitive pay & benefits and a culture that believes in investing in our Associates’ professional futures. With over 315 locations from coast to coast, AutoNation has an opportunity for you. We’ve sold over 13 million vehicles, the first automotive retailer to reach this milestone. Our success is driven by our commitment to delivering a peerless Customer experience through customer-focused sales and service processes. We believe deeply in giving back, and every car we sell helps to raise cancer research and treatment awareness with a Pink Plate. We have proudly raised over $25 million dollars to drive out cancer, create awareness, and support critical research.  Join us as we pave the way to moving our company, our communities and our industry forward. Apply today at a location near you or wherever you dream the road will take you.

Locations: Atlanta, GA; Orlando, FL; Remote  Are you interested in joining a hyper-growth, local company in one of the most exciting new business technology areas, autonomous (driverless) platforms? Beep is a well-funded, innovative company with openings for several key roles in the Orlando area. This is a chance to join the company on the ground floor with a team of professionals known for delivering a tremendous company culture with unparalleled business success. We are looking for new team members who thrive in a fast-paced environment and are motivated to learn about new, diverse markets. We all “wear multiple hats” and help the team succeed by doing what it takes to impact all aspects of the business required to deliver success for our customers.  General Summary: Beep is developing data and safety systems to support our fleet of autonomous shuttles. Software Engineers will be directly responsible for the prototyping, development, and scale delivery of in-vehicle and cloud-based systems to collect, process, and manage live AV operations. Software Engineers will work with senior technology leads to help define and deliver new product offerings to the broader autonomous vehicle market. Beep is currently growing its R&D organization in the Atlanta area, though candidates in the Orlando area as well as well-qualified remote employees will also be considered. This is a full-time, non-contract position, providing health and retirement benefits.  Responsibilities: Contribute to the engineering efforts in designing, implementing, and building software to manage the collection and processing of autonomous vehicle telemetry and sensor information from in-vehicle hardware Contribute to the engineering efforts in designing, implementing, and building cloud infrastructure and data systems to support real-time analysis. Integrate multiple sources of information (GPS, LiDAR, CAN, mapping, Bluetooth, NFC, REST, user-sources, etc.) into a platform Contribute and maintain tests for the application and related projects Contribute to the writing and maintenance of engineering and product documentation Participate in design review, architecture and implementation discussions for new features Contribute to improving the engineering process when it comes to feature planning and development, release planning, application versioning  Essential Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in software development in a team environment Experience with cloud infrastructure for systems development Experience developing applications using modern DevOps processes (unit tests, CI/CD workflows) Fluency in Python, and willingness to learn other languages as the need arises Experience consuming and/or designing REST APIs Experience working in an Agile development environment Experience using Git/GitHub including branching, merging, and pull requests to manage source control Familiarity with Terraform is a plus Familiarity with TensorFlow or other AI/ML frameworks is a plus Familiarity developing embedded software is a plus Strong verbal and written communication skills  Additional Notes:  Candidates should expect to participate in a code review as part of the interview process  Beep provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” employment relationship.  This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this position.  The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duty requested by the supervisor.

SUMMARY: The Software Engineer reports up through the Engineering Management team and performs software design, code, unit test, integration and testing to satisfy project requirements. Additionally, this position will be assigned other projects or tasks in alignment with the level and scope of the position.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES: Creates use cases and performs object-oriented analysis and design with close interaction with customer and domain experts. Develops testing routines and/or procedures. Creates flowcharts and other documentations to identify requirements for software and to propose possible solutions. Coordinates with hardware engineers and other staff to forecast whether the design will be feasible under cost and time constraints. Adheres to strict CMMI quality procedures to ensure first time quality in delivered products. Performs software requirements analysis and may lead subsystem level development teams. Directs software programming and development of documentation. Applies computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis to the software development process. May lead small development teams in terms of task breakdown, progress tracking, and technical issue resolution to ensure product success. Provides technical support for software maintenance or use. Communicates with customers and clients to establish maintenance procedures for software systems. Domestic and International travel to Military Installations in support of the Program activities may be required  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or related field required Minimum of Eight (8) years in software systems engineering, scripting and testing of constructive geospatial tools, software and associated products. Geospatial product development experience collaborating across multiple engineering disciplines with expertise in the testing and configuration of Government owned simulation tools such as the Army Site Terrain Tool (ASTT) and SE Core Gateway. Expertise in geospatial software design, build, scripting, integration, verification, validation, with an emphasis on validation by government agencies. Prefer experience with the Program or similar constructive M&S software Experience working in an Agile development environment Have significant JavaScript, Java, and/or C++ experience Experience working with service-based architectures Experience with distributed systems Junit or protractor for dev testing Preferred experience with development methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or TSP Experience using Relational Database Management Systems such as Postgres, MySQL, SQL Server, and/or Oracle Experience using an IDE such as Microsoft Visual Studio or Eclipse Experience using a source code repository such as BitBucket, Mercurial, GIT, or Subversion Experience using a defect management system such as Bugzilla, JIRA, or Fogbugz Experience using Microsoft Office Products such as PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and Outlook Holds a current minimum DOD Secret security clearance or ability to obtain one Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required  DESIRED SKILLS: Understanding of FOMs (Federation Object Models) Experience writing Python Scripts Experience using OpenGL or WebGL Military Simulation experience  JOB CONTEXT / PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This position is operated in an office and/or computer lab type environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to sit, stand, walk, and perform general office functions. The employee may also be required to lift up to 15 pounds occasionally. The employee may be required to sit for extended periods of time. The employee is occasionally required to stand, stoop, kneel, or crouch. Job Summary: The Play Disney Parks team is looking for a Senior Go Software Engineer to help us build ground-breaking digital experiences. As a Senior engineer you will be a key member of a small team of developers. Every day, you’ll work with team members across disciplines developing features and systems for the Play Disney Parks app. You’ll interact daily with our product managers to understand our domain and create technical solutions that push us forward.  The ideal candidate is someone who loves to code and can work hand-in-hand with experts from product development, design, software test and other partners to give our Guests the best-in-class experiences they expect.  About you: Strongly collaborative and excels on a focused team Desires to learn new things, try new technology, and seek opportunities to grow and mentor. A smart, results-oriented person with a mix of passion for solid application architecture and coding, who also has the soft skills of building relationships and consensus. Strong ability to self-regulate and problem solve through obstacles in a dynamic, fast-paced environment; maintains realistic estimations and escalates proactively when necessary Connects their code to the business problems being solved and translates effectively across business and technical boundaries; motivated to learn about and impact new markets  Responsibilities: Build well-designed, well-engineered, stable, scalable cloud based applications using Go in Google Cloud Platform. Manage and participate in the software development lifecycle, including the build, deployment, packaging, and dependency management stages Perform unit and system level testing on their application and all affected systems Work both independently and collaborate with a team of engineers with peer reviews to learn from and teach one another. Partner with business stakeholders to deliver features on time and to specifications Provide detailed estimates of work and ensure timely delivery of features. Continuously learn and keep up to date with emerging technologies to evaluate impact to business and member value. Deliver an outstanding experience for our Guests.  Basic Qualifications: 5+ years of full software development lifecycle experience Firm understanding of best practices for object-oriented and modularized software with a particular emphasis on Java or Go. Passionate about writing clean, well-organized, and production-ready code. Experience working with Git version control, or equivalent, in a collaborative team environment, creating pull requests and performing code reviews. Self-motivated with strong problem-solving skills. Excellent communication skills and experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams of product managers, designers, and engineers. An understanding of how to protect web applications from common security vulnerabilities. Be organized and able to remain productive even when you have multiple deliverables.  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), especially Firebase, Firestore, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub Working knowledge of Javascript and Node.js Full-stack development experience. Experience with C#/Unity  Required Education BS or BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience

Company Description  Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.  Job Description  As a software engineer on the Payments team, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the Payments Platform services and infrastructure that move money for Square. You will be deeply involved in the technical details of building highly available and reliable services, while also working with product teams to enable Square to rapidly build new capabilities for our merchants and buyers all over the world. You will: Build our Payments Platform, used by the rest of the organization and a key strategic asset of Square Design and implement high-volume, low-latency, distributed transaction processing systems, making thoughtful tradeoffs between consistency and availability when both are not possible Abstract away the legacy APIs of the financial world into consistent, coherent service APIs for Square’s products to build upon Build systems that manage customers’ sensitive data and hold Square to the highest standards for security and compliance Work cross-functionally with our product, business, and finance teams to develop Square’s global payments strategy See the big picture to design fault tolerant systems so the team can be brave, move fast, and break things, without ever showing a negative impact to customers  Qualifications  You have: Innate curiosity and a desire to be responsible for all aspects of reliably moving billions of dollars in a small, highly focused team Understanding and curiosity in creating highly available, scalable, low-latency, global systems Track record of pursuing self directed side projects, research, or open source projects Interest in changing the payments landscape in the US and globally Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of software development experience in Java, Go or similar

Duties and responsibilities Document and audit infrastructure design documents, capturing accurate landscape of deployed systems with their network and security controls. Manually & automatically deploy new or existing infrastructure resources to the company hosting accounts. Provision and configure tools to aid the development or monitoring of applications. Troubleshoot automation issues and find practical solutions that move projects forward in a timely manner. Experience with containerization and orchestration of web services. Experience with Git version control systems. Applied Research Associates, Inc. (ARA) has an opening for one or more persons to join our Endgame Framework software simulation development team. The Endgame Framework team is looking for ambitious software professionals who would like to contribute to the advancement and support of this software architecture and associated weapon effects applications. Endgame Framework is a cutting-edge software architecture that has a long history supporting the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) at Eglin Air Force Base and also the Joint Technical Coordinating Group for Munitions Effectiveness (JTCG/ME). Endgame Framework provides advanced development features to include reusable software modeling constructs, 3D geometric model interrogation and visualization, integrated Graphical User Interface (GUI) constructs, executive control across multiple processors, and a comprehensive set of M&S tools/utilities. Successful candidates will learn Endgame Framework programming constructs and contribute to specific modeling, simulation and analysis projects according to their abilities. This position is located at ARA’s Emerald Coast Division in the city of Niceville, Florida on the gulf coast of Florida. Applicants should possess a deep understanding of advanced software constructs and programming concepts using C++ in an object-oriented architecture. Applicants should also have good communication skills and a solid understanding of mathematical/physics concepts applicable to modeling and simulation solutions. Additional consideration will be given to candidates who possess skills/experience with simulation of kinetic or directed energy weapon effects, 3D geometric modeling, 3D visualization with OpenGL or Vulkan, Lua scripting, Unity, or Qt development. ARA is an employee-owned company with an excellent benefits package that includes: 401-K Retirement with employer matching contribution Employee Stock Ownership Plan Various insurance options including Flexible Spending Plan and a Health Savings Account (HSA) Paid leave and holidays Our specialty is developing innovative solutions to complex technical problems. We are seeking talented and motivated individuals who can help us meet our objective of providing quality service and software to our customers. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. simulation requirements provided by customers, to include: Define design/development approach Assign tasking to staff developers Communicate design concepts, development progress, and end results to management and customers through technical meetings and presentations (some travel involved) Track progress and assure completion of the project on time and within budget Create monthly status reports and delivering to customers Perform/support ECD’s CMMI Level 3 processes Participate in daily standup meetings, sprint planning and retrospectives as part of the Agile development process Required Skills: C++ software development with a good understanding of advanced software constructs and programming concepts Good understanding of mathematical and physics concepts Good communications skills and aptitude to work with a team of developers and customers Leadership abilities to organize, assign tasking, and complete projects using a team of developers Additional consideration for: M&S experience with engineering or mission level constructive simulations 3D geometric modeling and/or visualization with OpenGL or Vulkan Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio, C-Make, Lua, Linux, Unity, or Qt Department of Defense or weapon systems related experience (Air Force, Navy, Army or government contractor) M&S experience with directed energy effects Software development in a production CMMI Level 3 environment Qualifications Education Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related scientific/engineering discipline 5+ years of experience performing software development using C++ Behaviors Detail Oriented Dedicated Motivated Team Player Self Starter Innovative Goal Completion Loyal Flexibility Enthusiastic Ability to Make an Impact Experience Required 5 **RELOCATION ALLOWANCE AND/OR REMOTE WORK OPTIONS** *** GAME DEVELOPERS ENCOURAGED TO APPLY! *** SHOTOVER Systems, headquartered in beautiful Boulder, CO, designs and builds high-end gyro-stabilized airborne cameras for blockbuster movies as well as augmented reality software and hardware solutions used by the military, television stations, and firefighters around the world. We were doing AR before AR was cool, have bootstrapped to 70 employees, are profitable and growing. We love our customers and they love us. Plus, we aren’t a social network destroying democracy or a big company engaged in antitrust behavior. So there’s that. Job Overview: We’re capturing multiple channels of UHD video simultaneously and rendering 3D graphics in the scene in real time, along with generating a “Google Earth”- like virtual world that can be mixed and matched with video from the real world. You will be part of the team working on our next-generation version of this application (ARS) which will be focused on increasing support for higher definition video (8K), a larger variety of sensors, new hardware (Xavier AGX), integration with our flowgraph programming solution, and better scripting support (Python). Everything we do has to be done before the next vertical refresh rolls around, so speed is King -- but it also has to look good. If this sounds like game programming, that’s because it has a lot in common & refugees from that industry usually “get it”. Responsibilities: Design and implement UI architecture and components Profile and enhance software performance Debug complex software to improve software quality Work with software, hardware, and test engineers to develop new features and support new devices Perform in-field integrations with customers Required Skills: Expert command of C++11 (clean, robust, efficient code) Experience with higher level scripting languages, especially Python Comfortable with modern development practices Experience with non-blocking, threaded programming Strong skills in object-oriented design Strong debugging/profiling/diagnostics skills Familiarity with networking concepts and protocols Experience with UX development Desired Skills: Experience with Linux, Visual Studio, Vulkan, IP networking, etc Experience with digital video – processing, encoding, and transmission Strong background in computer vision Game or Simulation programmer? You’ll fit right in! POSITION SUMMARY: The Field Automation Support Engineer will be responsible for supporting the PLC control logic used to control and monitor switchgear systems. The engineer will also be responsible for supporting the SCADA application to ensure that all specified software operations and features are provided, accurate, and intuitive. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Maintains a positive attitude. Always receptive to feedback, willing to learn, and embracing continuous improvement. Communicates effectively with all levels of employees and management. Confirm project requirements by reviewing the program objective vs. hardware provided. Provides remote and on-site support for local filed engineers. Provide automation support for custom PLC programs with both function block and ladder logic style programming using a standards-based approach. Provide automation support for project specific SCADA control and monitoring screens. Participates in the continuous improvement of PLC / SCADA programming standards. Carry cell phone and be available for automation support 24/7. Travel Percentage: 15-25% PROFICIENCIES: Strong understanding of PLC Network Architecture. This includes, but is not limited to Redundant PLC Controllers, Remote IO Drops, and all associated network protocols. Strong understanding of Emergency Power Switchgear Systems. This includes, but is not limited to No-Load Tests, ATS Load Tests, Manual/Auto Load Control, and Generator Demand. Ability to support custom PLC programming for new Emergency Power Switchgear Systems. Ability to support custom PLC programming for legacy Switchgear Systems. These modifications will be implemented to an on-line facility, and a smooth transition from old to new automation is crucial. Utility/Generator Switchgear Systems provide power to the on-line facility at all times, making it extremely difficult to implement incremental upgrades. For this reason, full, accurate simulation of the system in the various stages of the upgrade is also required. Ability to support lifelike software simulation of Emergency Power Switchgear Systems Ability to host live demonstrations for existing and potential customers, highlighting the strengths of our switchgear automation. Collaborate with other departments, commissioning agents, and end users to come up with improvements and new features for our Switchgear Systems. QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Applicable degree in Automation and Control Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent combination of formal education, training and experience. Ability to manage multiple projects at once. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to thrive in a diverse environment with minimal supervision. Proficiency with windows based operating systems and TCP/IP networks. Knowledge of standard data types (Boolean, Integer, Double Integer, Floating Point, etc…) Familiarity with Object-Oriented Programming. Ability to interpret schematics, wiring prints, point lists, and other documentation. Experience with a variety of communication methods, such as Genius, SRTP, Ethernet Global Data, Profinet, and Modbus. Experience with a variety of programming PLCs and SCADAs, including LM90, VersaPro, Proficy, RSLogix 5000, ProWORX, Step 7, and Wonderware. Understanding of 3 phase power. Understanding of diesel generator start/stop control, synchronizing, load sharing, and soft loading. This position reports to the Field Automation Support Team Manager and is a ‘home office’ position. We offer flexible vacation time, a matching 401K plan, profit sharing, full health, life, vision and dental benefits. #LI-BJ1  Organization: Smart Infrastructure Company: Siemens Industry, Inc. About Dexcom: Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world.  Summary: Dexcom is expanding through a growing reputation as the technology leader in diabetes management and patient satisfaction. We have become the standard bearer in the emerging digital health space. We’re adding new staff who can further improve our innovative life-changing products.  The position is for a Staff Software Development Engineer to enhance our current generation and develop our next generation Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) technology. You will plan, design, develop and test software systems and applications for new products. These include local computer-based, cloud-based and internet-related tools. You will work to engineering project plans collaborating with internal R&D and enterprise software groups, along with our Quality and Clinical organizations. You will document your software solutions, following the relevant quality processes to meet Dexcom business needs. Functional Description: Technical Individual Contributor Plans, designs, develops and tests software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products including cloud-based or internet-related tools. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs, and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs. Using current programming language and technologies, writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Lead development of software features for our next generation CGM devices Collaborate with stakeholders to define software requirements and design specifications Represent needs of a specific product and assist with creating development backlog for the software team Pro-actively identify and mitigate risks and resolve road blockers Design, implement and test new products and improve existing products Analyze and troubleshoot field and factory reported product defects Within a team, execute projects for on-time delivery of project goals and objectives Contribute to and review technical solutions for product improvements Identify and implement engineering and quality process improvements Contribute to driving Dexcom’s improved gross margin with design improvements Other duties as assigned  Required Qualifications: Proficiency in design, implementation and debugging of .NET Framework (C#), ASP .NET, familiar with Windows and MAC APIs and cybersecurity practices. C, C++ High sense of accountability Experience with soliciting and documenting requirements Excellent communicator both verbally and in written form Ability to work in a fast paced / dynamic team environment and possess time management skills to meet schedules  Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience with product development process for medical devices, especially 62304 Prior experience with low power microcontrollers in a battery powered system Experienced with devices with a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) interface.. Agile development  Experience and Education Requirements: Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 8-12 years related experience or Master’s degree and 5-7 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 2-4 years of experience.  Travel Required: Up to 25%  Functional/Business Knowledge: Possesses advanced knowledge of technical principles and theories. Recommends solutions in support of functional objectives tied to overall company objectives and strategies.  Scope: Demonstrates significant technical expertise, collaboration with others and independent thought. Anticipates potential complex problems requiring an in-depth evaluation. Demonstrates strategic thinking and commercial/industry understanding in functional projects.  Judgement: Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other colleagues.  #LI-FH1  An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.  To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

Complex problems. Inspired solutions.  Syncroness, Inc. Job Title: Software Engineer III  Who we are Syncroness provides inspired solutions to highly complex business and technical problems. We focus on accelerating time-to-market and ensuring a profitable outcome for our clients.  The Software Engineer designs and develops software applications. Performs coding, debugging, testing and troubleshooting throughout the application development process. The ESIII with work with other engineering and functional areas to obtain optimum utilization of equipment, machinery and resources. May direct junior level software engineers.  This is a contract position located onsite in DeLeon Springs, Florida, which is located west of Daytona Beach. This position requires access to technology, materials, software or hardware that is controlled by export laws of the US. In order to be eligible, you must be either a US Citizen or Permanent Resident.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Develop software modules using the C programming language for real time embedded systems. Develop test software modules using C, C++, Python, and/or Labview programming language. Develop build automation scripts using Python, Bash, and Windows batch files. Participate in software, electronics and system design reviews. Understand how to read schematics and understand electronics designs. Understand concepts needed for low level software development on “bare metal” systems. Understand concepts needed to create drivers for hardware interfaces. Test software using lab instrumentation such as oscilloscopes and signal generators. File bug reports for defects noticed during testing. Correct software bugs and resolve software bug reports. Support other software engineers in the software development process. Participate in product software failure analysis activities and compile test and failure analysis reports. Generates software design documentation and report data from tests. Keep accurate and complete records of engineering activities. May provide training and/or direction to technicians. May provide input to bid and proposal activities. May provide communications and/or presentations to customers, suppliers or vendors. May require participation in product field tests requiring 10% travel. Requirements 4-year degree from an accredited university in BSCS, Engineering, or related field OR a combination of education and relevant experience. A minimum of 5 years of experience in software. Experience with device driver and operating system implementation. Also known as “Low Level” or “Bare metal”. Experience with microprocessor components and peripherals (UART, SPI, I2C, DMA, interrupts, clock configuration, etc.) Experience with peripherals, such as Analog to Digital Converters (ADCs), Digital to Analog Converters Experience with FreeRTOS and Micrium uC-OSII and uC-OSIII (or equivalent) Experience developing embedded software in C or C++; additional languages a plus. Electrical/Electronic design experience – schematic capture and board layout. Desktop and network software development experience a plus. Good working knowledge of full software development lifecycle. DACs, etc. Familiarity of software tools (requirements tracking, compiler, assemblers, debuggers, programmers, JTAG, etc. Working knowledge of data acquisition concepts, instrument control, test, measurement and implementation of control interfaces to hardware. Knowledge of software systems architecture for embedded real-time systems. Digital signal processing algorithm modelling and implementation for audio and /or radio frequency (RF) applications in MATLAB. ARM Cortex M Processor Architecture. Analog Devices Blackfin processors. Digital logic design using Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA) and Complex Programmable Logic Devices *CPLDs) with Verilog and VHDL and verification with ModelSim. Familiarity with Intel (formerly Altera) Quartus, Xilinx Vivado design tools, Lattice iCEcube2 software. Practical skills for bench-level work, including the ability to configure test equipment to verify design. Ability to use original thinking and ingenuity to solve problems. Ability to write technical reports and contribute to presentations. Proficiency in MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Teams. Must show initiative and motivation, and have the ability to act independently to resolve technical issues.  This job description doesn't constitute a contract of employment and Syncroness may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.  Syncroness is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.  1 | Page syncroness headquarters•10875 dover st westminster, colorado 80021•303.429.5005•www.syncroness.com

Company Description  Why join Nextech? We are a leader in specialty healthcare technology solutions, headquartered in Tampa, FL. We are an ever-growing team, guided by our iCREATE values of Integrity, Collaboration, Respect, Empowerment, Accountability, Trust, and Excellence. We hold these values in high regard and are driven to succeed in all we do. We’re committed to hiring and retaining talent, which is why we invest in our employees through competitive pay, a generous bonus structure, great healthcare, a comprehensive wellness program, and many other benefits. If you are a software engineer, finance or accounting professional, customer support specialist, or a business development expert with a passion for healthcare technology (just to name a few), we want to hear from you. We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics are encouraged to apply. If you are a candidate in need of assistance or an accommodation in the application process, please contact talent@nextech.com.  Job Description  The Software Engineer I role is primarily devoted to developing and documenting software changes in Nextech products. Engineers work with existing Nextech products to evaluate and diagnose any improvements desired, as designated by the Product Management department, or issues within these products. This role reports to the Software Team Manager, who is in charge of assigning and coordinating most work among the members of the subteam in the Development department. The Software Engineer I should be able to work independently on assigned projects and tasks while coordinating their progress with other members of the Nextech team. Engineers at this level are tasked with contributing to a variety of Nextech products while learning the system. All activities must be in compliance with Equal Employment Opportunity laws, HIPAA, ERISA, and other regulations, as appropriate. Essential Functions: In addition to working in accordance with appropriate conduct and behavioral standards, specific responsibilities of this role include: Transforming requirements into functional software with input from many sources Communicating with all levels of the organization, often balancing competing priorities Assisting in the writing of functional specifications and planning documents for software design Estimating deadlines on projects as designed Implementing software changes in Angular, AngularJS, C#, SQL (additional languages may be used) Testing and code reviewing other team members’ work Evaluating advanced issues for customer-facing issue resolution Coordinating with the Technical Services team members to successfully provide customer-facing support for data conversions, HL-7 integrations, and other assigned projects  Qualifications  Minimum Requirements: A passion for excellence in software development Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field Strong technical and analytical qualities Ability to work well within a team, strong communication skills Creative, motivated, self-starter A strong attention to detail Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of and comfort with Microsoft Visual Studio, C#, .NET, MSDN Knowledge of and comfort with Angular, AngularJS, or other JavaScript frameworks Experience using Microsoft SQL Server Experience with Git source control Knowledge of medical systems and processes Experience with TypeScript  Additional Information  Total Rewards Nextech is pleased to offer a variety of health, wellness and lifestyle benefit offerings for all fulltime employees: Generous annual bonus opportunity iCREATE Employee Recognition Program Insurance : Choice of Medical, Dental, and Vision plans Wellness Program including discounts on medical premiums Health Savings Account Flexible Spending Account 15 days PTO at date of hire (increases with years of service) + 10 paid holidays + 1 floating holiday Volunteer Time Off 100% Company-Paid Parental leave 401(k) with Employer Match 100% Company-Paid Life Insurance and Short/Long Term Disability Insurance Company-Sponsored 529 College Savings Plan Corporate Discounts on Retail, Travel, and Entertainment Pet Insurance options Working Environment Works generally at a desk in a well-lighted, air-conditioned cubicle/office, with moderate noise levels. Long-distance or air travel as needed –not to exceed 5% travel. Periods of stress may occur. Physical Demands Activities require a significant amount of sitting at office and work desks and in front of a computer monitor. Some walking and standing relative to interaction with other personnel.

Aurora North is a Burlington, Vermont based software company that develops software focused on enhancing legal operations, increasing efficiency, and reducing risk. Aurora North, an industry leader known for providing advanced technology solutions to law firms all over the world, is currently hiring an experienced Implementation Engineer to contribute to our growth and success. Our company specializes in the installation and implementation of industry standard legal systems and enterprise solutions. We provide the highest quality software services to the legal industry, including software products for intellectual property law firms throughout North America and Europe. Come work with an outstanding team of passionate, focused individuals while continuing to build your technical expertise and business acumen. The ideal candidate is hard working, detail oriented, has a strong ability to multitask, is a fast learner, is goal driven, proficient with technology, demonstrates excellent customer service skills and has at least 3+ years of experience with solid knowledge of: software development, SQL Server, data and system integration best practices, project life cycles, and collaborative development. We are looking for an energetic, fun addition to the team who is willing to take ownership of their role and grow within our team. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Installing and implementing industry standard legal systems and enterprise solutions. Creating integrations between standard and third-party systems using SQL, APIs, and other tools. Upgrading production systems to the latest versions. Migrating on premises solutions to the Cloud using REST APIs via 3rd party tools. Owning the end-to-end implementation of Aurora North and partner software products and services. This includes planning, development, installation, configuration, deployment, and support. Owning client communication process and setting client expectations on a project basis. Assisting with product rollouts by ensuring client product owners and trainers are trained to be fully conversant with the software. Prioritizing and managing own workload to meet client expectations. Maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; bench-marking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies. Contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Qualifications 3+ years of experience in a customer-facing role 3+ years of experience writing Microsoft SQL Server queries with a solid understanding of relational database structure and normalization Strong experience in the following technical areas: XML, JQUERY/JSON, REST/SOAP APIs Experience with the following is helpful, but not required Experience with Legal systems such as Aderant Expert, Elite Enterprise, Elite 3E, iManage, OpenText, NetDocuments Intapp Time, Intapp Walls, Intapp Open, Intapp One Place, Intapp Pricing Integration tools: Dell Boomi, Intapp Integrate/Integration Builder ETL Processes and Best Practices Sisense BI & Analytics Microsoft Exchange Web Services/Microsoft Graph Other Skills, Requirements and Competencies Four-year degree in a relevant field or equivalent combination of experience and education. Problem Solving/Critical Thinking: Resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; doesn’t stop at the first answer, investigates the issue thoroughly. Customer Focus: Acts with customers in mind; dedicated to meeting and exceeding internal and external customer expectations. Communication: Listens to the needs of each customer and clearly shares their needs with the appropriate group. Teamwork: Balances team and individual responsibilities; provides and welcomes constructive feedback; contributes to the group with a positive attitude. Organizational Support: Completes tasks accurately and on time; follows policy and procedure guidelines. Quality: Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness with tasks; looks for ways to improve our processes always focusing on quality; applies feedback to improve performance. Attendance/Punctuality: Is consistently at work and on time; ensures responsibilities are covered when absent. Maintains professionalism while balancing multiple tasks and working in a fast-paced team environment. Obtains the required information by utilizing internal resources to problem solve. What We Offer We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including full-premium-paid medical, dental and vision, HRA, FSA, EAP, excellent holiday/vacation/sick time off, and 401(k). About Us Our company is a highly respected, top-tier provider of legal software and associated services throughout the United States, Canada and Europe. We have been in business since 2005 and have an unparalleled reputation in the legal market. We are seeking a highly qualified, talented person who enjoys working in a small company environment. While we appreciate all resume submittals only candidates with experience most relevant to our needs will be contacted. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Parental leave Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Do you now, or will you in the future require visa sponsorship to continue working in the United States? Experience: SQL: 2 years (Required) Work Location: Multiple locations Visa Sponsorship Potentially Available: No: Not providing sponsorship for this job Company's website: https://www.auroranorthsoftware.com/ Work Remotely: Yes COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

Category: Engineering Location: Melbourne, Florida US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes Clearance Type: Secret Telecommute: No –Teleworking not available for this position Shift: 1st Shift Travel Required: Yes, 10 % of the Time Positions Available: 1  Climb to new heights on your journey when you start Defining Possible with Northrop Grumman. Enjoy a purposeful career in aeronautics that is crucial to the way we connect and protect our world across land, sea, and air. Bring your experience and take advantage of this opportunity to discover how you can start to push past possible and achieve your goals today. Enjoy a diverse, collaborative environment with professionals across the nation ready to help launch your career. Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Principal Software Engineer - Information Assurance to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. Position is located in Melbourne, Florida. The Software Assurance Engineer will interface with system security engineers for overall security mitigations and security architecture creation. This role will also support the development of mitigations for software vulnerabilities found during analysis/test. Research into industry best practices for software assurance and providing feedback to overall software assurance team is expected. Essential Functions: Implementation of a software assurance plan, policies and procedures Code reviews for security issues Support of the software architecture ensuring good security design patters, and coding practices are implemented Running static code and dynamic code analysis Fuzzing and binary disassembly tools We offer flexible work arrangements, 9/80 schedule (every other Friday off), phenomenal learning opportunities, exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers, and a very friendly team environment. We are looking for self-motivated, proactive, and goal-oriented people to help us grow our services and become even better at what we do. Our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) provide benefits for the member, our leaders and the company. Our ERGs offer opportunities to be a friend, be active, be a volunteer, be a leader, to be recognized and to be yourself. Every ERG is inclusive of all employees! DIVSW #LI-JR3  Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) discipline from an accredited university with 5-years of software engineering experience OR a Master’s Degree in (STEM) from an accredited university with 3-years of software engineering experience. Experience in a software/system security role Some familiarity or experience with software test/development, use of static code analysis, dynamic code analysis and fuzzing tools. An active in-scope DoD Secret level clearance and the ability to obtain/maintain program (PAR) access are required to apply and be considered for this role. o On Day-1 an active DoD Secret clearance and program (PAR) access are required to start. Preferred Qualifications: Any one of the following certifications; CISSP, CISM, CEH or CSSLP. Current active SCI or Secret Special Program Access level clearance Military Aircraft experience helpful. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong organizational skills to handle multiple priorities. Experience with networking basics needed. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

JOB Perform responsible technical and analytical work involving the design, programming, testing and implementation of application based systems and projects. Furnishes user support for other areas as required by the Information Technology Department. Work is performed under general supervision of the Applications Development Manager.  EXAMPLE OF DUTIES Defines and documents system scope, current logical view, proposed logical view, applications and general requirements using structured and object oriented design and analysis techniques. Identifies opportunities for improvement within the systems and actively proposes effective solutions. Develops, modifies, tests and implements software solutions using the appropriate programming languages and methodologies. Analyzes the impact of proposed changes on existing systems and workflows. Provides expertise for systems, user support and requirements gap analysis to both internal and external customers. Works with software vendors to resolve problems and participates in vendor product implementations including upgrades, patching and testing. Performs other related tasks as assigned.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Demonstrated ability to translate business problems into technology solutions that consider security, performance, usability, quality, cross-system interdependencies, scalability and total cost of ownership. Knowledge of the principles and techniques of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) along with other software development practices. Must be able to apply appropriate and effective levels of creativity in the development and implementation of software solutions. Specific knowledge of .NET Framework, ASP MVC, ASP.Net, Web Services, C#, SQL, JavaScript, XML, HTML5 and CSS in the Windows environment is required. Must possess working knowledge of relational database concepts in a SQL Server environment including data modeling and SQL Report Server functionality. Must be able to design and prepare technical reports as required. General knowledge of networks, the operation, uses and capabilities of installed computer and related equipment. Working knowledge of personal computers, Microsoft operating systems, and Internet environments, as well as general knowledge of other operating system environments. Must have excellent analytical, diagnostic and trouble shooting skills. Must have ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with fellow employees, superiors and other departments. Must possess effective oral and written communication skills including the ability to follow instruction and complete tasks with minimal supervision. Must be able to lift or displace up to 50 pounds.  SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or an equivalent degree in a computer programming related field or equivalent experience. Programming experience should include but not be limited to 2+ years of .Net Framework 4.5 and above, ASP.Net, ASP.Net MVC, C#, Web Services (REST and SOAP), SQL, JavaScript, HTML5, XML, JSON, CSS and SQL Report Server. Experience with agile methodologies and/or data analytics is preferred.

Introduction Will you transform the future of online education? Make a difference while building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to benefit teachers, administrators, parents, and students with innovative, potential-maximizing technologies – Join Us! Weld North Education seeks a Senior Software Engineer in Test to design, develop, and maintain automation systems and tools to be used by development and test engineers. About Us Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn. A Day in the Life as a Senior Software Engineer in Test As a Senior Software Engineer in Test of the Product and Enterprise Operations team, you will spend your days developing and applying software development and test automation skills in support of Quality Assurance tasks. You will work collaboratively with other automation team members in a high-functioning team to create high-quality results. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 4 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience Expert knowledge in one domain and experience working in other domains. Experience coding in languages such as C#/.Net, and/or Java. Experience designing, writing, and executing automated and manual test cases Experience with automated testing tools, such as Cypress or Selenium Web driver Understanding of cloud-based web technology Proficient in Atlassian products, such as JIRA and Confluence. Excellent communication, coding, and analytical problem-solving skills Knowledge with Agile methodologies and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Compensation and Benefits We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university. Equal Opportunity Employer WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Title Software Engineer Sensor development DoD Location Orlando, FL Job Number 247/3037, 3041 Residency US Citizens Only Clearance Clearance Apply for after start Duration 1 Year or more Pay Rate 80/hr Per diem Yes split available that can net about 1000 extra per month to cover lodging Overtime Not Available Shifts Monday-Thursday 4x40 We are hiring a contract embedded Real Time C/C++ Version 11 or higher / Linux software engineer who will be working on Secret projects for a military/DoD subcontractor. The position requires a candidate to integrate algorithms into C++ applications. Candidates will need ability to perform utilization planning and processor design and sensor development. The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity? Tanzu Mission Control is a new cloud service that is part of the VMware Tanzu Portfolio. Mission Control is designed to give customers a single pane of glass for all their Kubernetes clusters needs so they can monitor, verify, apply policy, back-up and restore with ease. Tanzu Mission Control is a foundational part of our Build, Run, Manage, vision and will have a large impact within the VMware family of products. We are looking for an engineer to help build, expand, and maintain services that enable customers to onboard smoothly and to scale Tanzu Mission Control to meet the ever-growing needs of our customers.  What is primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for? We need someone who can collaborate with other engineers within and across the team as well as product management to innovate core technology that will change the way we onboard customer and scale various aspects of Tanzu Mission Control. You will be working with the team to design and implement new feature to improve the customer onboarding experience. You will also work on services and tools that enable other teams to accelerate their development and allow them to easily scale their services.  Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? Deliver Quality: We expect that you provide sufficient automated testing for the functionality you are delivering. Participate in System Design: We expect you to take an active role in design reviews of feature and functionality that is related to your area of work. We do not to expect you to lead the design instead we expect you to actively seek clarification and try to understand the impact the design will have on your work. Collaborate: We expect you to actively work with other engineers on the team and other teams that require your help or are users of the functionality you own. What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? As part of the Tanzu Mission Control team, you will: Most of your time will be spent writing well tested code using GO. You will ensure that your code changes reach production. When delivering functionality, we love to see a demo of your accomplishment. Collaborate in-person and through Slack with other developers to move your code changes through code review into production. Collaborate in-person and through Slack with other developers by reviewing their code changes to gain a better understanding of our team’s code base.  What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like? The hiring manager for this role is Tim Hinderliter, Senior Engineering Manager. His expertise includes delivering a wide range of products and services, open source projects at VMware, and numerous infrastructure and networking products at successful startups. Tim's leadership style provides his people the opportunity to demonstrate ownership of their areas, while helping them refine their plans to better connect to customer needs and other parts of the larger business. Tim strongly believes in a "growth mindset", and encourages his team to experiment and learn. Tim currently leads a team which consists of 6 engineers that own a variety of responsibilities ranging from onboarding and billing customers to enabling authentication for both users and clusters within TMC. What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware? You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com. Employee Stock Purchase Plan Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types Generous Time Off Programs 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.) Healthy and local inspired snacks in all our pantries #teamtanzu  Category : Engineering and Technology Subcategory: Software Engineering Experience: Manager and Professional Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time Posted Date: 2021-04-29  VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
