Job Purpose: SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) should be able to work equally and effectively in both development and testing roles. SDETs take part in complete software development process as well as software testing process. SDET professional's knowledge is entirely focused on testability, robustness, automation and performance of software testing and development. SDET should be able to able to develop and build tools whenever needed to assist any testing activities. SDET should be able to analyze, suggest and create proof of concept for third party tools and application that would aid in software testing process. Job Location: The position is remote/home office. Strong preference for Boca Raton, FL area or the following states: AZ, CA, FL,GA, MA, MO, NE, NV, OH, PA, TX. Job Responsibilities: Essential Functions: Design and build out the Automation framework, have their own ideas and direction. Diagnostic skills – as the automation framework is being built and then used for testing this person needs to be able to and want to dig into bugs/failures and identify the root cause for failures. Experience with C#, SQL Server and message bus skills is essential. Develop automation scripts by studying information needs; confer with users, study systems flow, data usage and work processes and investigate problem areas. Develop well-designed, and efficient test automation code(s). Determine operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development and proposed solutions for automation. SDET should able to perform Test Automation and setting up frameworks on multiple application platforms like API, Webservices , Data pipeline, Web, Mobile, and Desktop. Investigate customer problems referred by the technical support team. Create & manage bug reports and communicate with the team. Able to build different test scenarios and acceptance tests. SDET needs to handle technical communications with Partners to understand client's systems or APIs. SDET also work with deployments teams and resolving any level issues for the system. SDET should also able to set up, maintain, and operate test automation frameworks. SDET should spin up and down and maintain testing environment as needed for automation.  Non-Essential Functions: Understand client-server architecture, MS Windows services, web server technologies (IIS) and general networking knowledge Job Requirements: Required Education and Experience: 5+ experience working as SDET. 3+ year of experience in test automation with Python/Java/Javascript/SQL with databases and APIs. 5+ years of experience in automated testing. Proven experience in reviewing requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback. Experience creating detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases for functional and non-functional testing. Experience with tracking defect management processes and prioritizing bugs. Ability to work cross-functionally with other teams to organize testing responsibilities. Comfortable and adaptable in a fast-paced environment. Experience with black box and white box testing with understanding of/experience with SQA methodologies, techniques, and approaches. Familiarity with bug reporting systems such as target process. Experience with design and development automation Framework using. Net, C# and NUnit. Experience with Data Driven Frameworks using XML and Database (MS SQL Server)  Preferred Education and Experience: Experience as test lead is preferred Experience with lamda test cross browser tool Experience with target process Experience with API Automation Experience with Azure devops  Expected Competencies: Excellent verbal and written communication skills Detail-oriented and able to work at an efficient pace Multi-tasking abilities Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability What we Offer: Start-up culture with opportunity to make an impact in your role and our team immediately Compensation corresponding to the value you bring to our team Excellent on-the-job learning opportunity to grow your skills Support of a diverse and international team to reach your goals We are unable to provide relocation assistance for this role We are unable to provide employment sponsorship for this role - unrestricted work authorization required Company Description: Cendyn is the leading innovative cloud software and services provider for the hospitality industry. Their software solutions drive sales, marketing, and revenue performance for tens of thousands of hotels across the globe with a focus on integrated hotel CRM, hotel sales, and revenue strategy technology platforms. The Cendyn Hospitality Cloud offers a complete set of software services for the industry, aligning marketing, sales, and revenue teams to optimize their strategies and drive performance and loyalty across their business units. With office headquarters in Boca Raton, FL, USA, and offices around the globe in Germany, Singapore, Thailand, and Japan, Cendyn proudly serves customers in 143 countries. Their software solutions deliver billions of data-driven, personalized communications on behalf of their customers every year. For more information on Cendyn, visit cendyn.com. As a member of the Visual Engineering Team, the Visual Software Engineer will be responsible for the development and/or integration of Fidelity’s image generation (IG) systems. This includes the design and implementation of IG software solutions, integration of various COTS software packages, and support of Fidelity’s IG maintenance activities. Specific duties will include: Developing high-quality, performance-critical software modules for use in real-time training simulators. Following the formal processes and guidelines established by the Software Engineering Team for design, implementation, unit testing, code reviews, and documentation. Carrying out a wide range of image generator (IG) support and integration tasks such as host-side interface development, test harness development, IG build configuration management, IG regression testing, and defect isolation/identification. Providing technical support for the creation of terrain databases, 3D models, visual effects, and the accompanying toolsets. Working closely with other engineering teams to ensure proper setup and integration of visual and audio system hardware and software, including maintaining configuration files, generating mapping files and batch files, writing scripts, coordinating efforts with computer generated forces (CGF), and calibrating multi-channel displays and surround-sound audio. Communicating regularly with subject matter experts, visual engineering manager, software engineering manager, program managers, and technology partners to ensure immersive qualities meet or exceed training needs. Planning, prioritizing, organizing, and performing technical work and ensure the integrity of significant and diverse visualization projects. Providing significant input to the analysis and conceptual design of proposed projects, utilizing professional experience in the development of specifications, design parameters, and alternative solutions. Assisting in determining the technical direction for implementation of visualization projects. Coordinating design activity with other engineers on technical aspects relating to the project. Taking initiative to suggest specific modifications to design and development activities to improve future results. Maintain thorough and accurate documentation of all work. Fidelity Technologies Corporation is an equal opportunity organization. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Our mission is to help people fulfill their passion to make a difference for others. Non-profit, faith-based, and political organizations depend on Qgiv to power their fundraising through our industry leading software and growing suite of products and services. We absolutely love the work our clients do and we’re looking for someone who can help them achieve their mission through the Front-End Engineer role.  “What would you say, you do here?” We are looking for someone to help us bring our control panel to the next level! Over the next several months, we’ll be updating our front-end stack so your familiarity with modern web development but comfort (and tolerance) with older libraries like jQuery will be a key part of this role. Our control panel has lots of moving pieces so we’re looking for someone who can keep the front-end for a complex system as simple as possible, writing code that’s efficient, scalable and testable. You’ll also be a part of a front-end team that is just kicking off a bigger initiative to use shared components across our platform.  On the technical side, your experience in the following will also be necessary: Experience with JavaScript (ES6), HTML, CSS/SCSS You’ve spent some time with a front-end stack that includes React, Webpack, Babel, Jest (or any other unit test library) Experience in older front-end tools like jQuery and Gulp Familiarity with the BEM CSS naming convention Implementing UI using existing front-end patterns GitHub (or some other method of version control)  We pride ourselves on building a quality product. As a Front-End Engineer, you’ll take business requirements and leverage Voice of Customer to help us build a world-class user experience. Collaborating with other members of the Product team, you’ll implement designs and front-end code for new features and updates to our existing platform. When bugs in the system popup, you’re able to dig in, debug the issue, and find a resolution that solves the root cause.  As a member of the Product Team, you would also help us with maintaining our 2-week development cycle, keeping bugs in the system at a minimum, developing documentation for code you write, and helping us further improve and optimize our front-end framework. Members of our team are effective communicators and can self-manage their time as it relates to our team’s goals. You love finding an elegant solution to a problem, and you’re passionate about the code you craft.  Though our platform is easy to use, there is a lot going on under-the-hood. You’ll be spending a lot of time learning the ins and outs of our control panel with a goal of being a product expert in this area by 90 days. You should be comfortable and resourceful in debugging code and troubleshooting across various browsers. Be okay with not knowing things, but strive to learn as much as possible. We are looking for someone that is hungry for feedback and wants to grow from working on a team of engineers.  What’s it like to work at Qgiv? We are guided by our Core Values: introspection, empathy, persistence, openness, and passion. We work hard to meet deadlines and goals, but we also like to have fun. Although we’re temporarily remote due to COVID-19, once we return to the office, we’ll get back to enjoying monthly birthday cake and more free snacks and beverages than should be allowed.  While remote, we stay connected through video and chat through daily stand-ups, weekly coffee talks, and monthly happy hours. We strive to create a culture where individuals can grow personally and professionally, and maintain a work environment you actually look forward to every day. Most importantly, we know that at the end of the day our software helps make the world just a little bit better.

Credit cards and other financial products haven't changed in decades, and it's the customers who are suffering. Interest rates are too high, and so are the fees. By redesigning the way people use their daily money, we aim to modestly but measurably contribute to our customers and their families' financial security and life satisfaction. Our metric is happiness. Nirvana Technology (nirvana.tech) is a financial technology startup in stealth mode with a launch date of fall 2021. We are building a digital service featuring a credit card – plus checking, savings and term loan features – combined into a single all-purpose primary account. Our founding CEO, industry pioneer Bill Harris, has started eight other financial technology companies, including Personal Capital and PayPal. Additionally, our founding leadership team and advisors include industry veterans who've built other pioneering fintechs. The team attributes much of their prior success to the employees they have been able to hire, develop, and retain while fostering a growth mindset within their organizations. We are committed to the same at Nirvana and are excited to be hiring for critical roles to join our founding team. We're already fully funded, and you can get in on the ground floor stock option plan, be part of building our organization, and influencing our company's vision. It is really a dream opportunity for someone looking for an opportunity to create, take risks, learn and have an immediate impact. Sounds a little like Nirvana.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to: Build new consumer facing banking experiences that are intuitive, beautiful and simple to use Design, develop, test, scale and deploy Progressive Web Apps Write robust highly tested, well crafted code that you can be proud of Be passionate to build the best customer experience through technical and product decisions Work in a cross-functional agile team Instrument, test, profile, and code review software Foster and thrive in a growth mindset culture - using every opportunity to learn, discover and grow To be successful in this role, it would help if you have: 3+ years of experience in designing and building responsive web apps, with single page design and services integration 3+ year of building web pages using ReactJS, Angular JS or similar, HTML5, CSS3, JSON Understanding of cross-browser compatibility, progressive enhancement and graceful degradation, responsive design, website performance, and accessibility Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field. Entrepreneurial mentality with the passion for our mission Passionate about quality and writing clean, readable code that scales and performs well. A collaborative teammate, a fast learner, with a positive and can-do attitude. Love coding and to tackle problems big and small and will stop at nothing to get the job done! Curious and enjoy learning new things to deliver an impactful solution for our users  Should you wish to learn more go ahead and apply for the position and we'll be in touch! We appreciate your interest in Nirvana. Bold, passionate, creative thinkers and risk-takers excel at Nirvana. Inquisitive Individuals with the desire to discover and learn. We have some truly new ideas, but we know we need a diverse team to make it happen. We want individuals to join us in taking risks in the products we set out to build and take to market. Individuals who are simultaneously strategists, leaders, and individual contributors who thrive in early-stage companies where everyone wears a collection of hats and enjoys doing so. We're in Miami, near the airport. Once the world settles down, we'll run a hybrid schedule of intense collaboration (and pizza) at the office combined with optionally-remote project work. Come enjoy the sunshine and what we believe will be the next tech hub: Silicon Beach! We are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive environment and to encourage these values in everyone on our team. We provide an environment of mutual respect where opportunities are available without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We believe that diversity and inclusion for people from all walks of life is key to our success as a company.
